LGTM, byt why we don't want to do this? Could U please elaborate? References to bzs/docs appreciated."}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-01-29 17:55:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> LGTM, byt why we don't want to do this? Could U please elaborate?
 > References to bzs/docs appreciated.

When ironic is enabled on the overcloud the ironic nodes are reported as hypervisors. We only want to run upgrade-non controller scripts for compute nodes(hosting VMs) and this change filters out the ironic nodes from the hypervisors list to allow it."}, {'account_id': 21537, 'date': '2018-01-30 08:01:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21537, 'date': '2018-01-30 08:09:19.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Workflow+1 by Yurii Prokulevych <yprokule@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Ignore ironic nodes when registering compute nodes

We don't want to upgrade ironic overcloud nodes so this change
filters them out from the overcloud hypervisors list.

Change-Id: I2ad47415a7f9b28a9a73c178fea79f5fcb689096

commit_message:
Fix conditional for oooq ffu scenario transformation.

The current check gives that error[1]

   The conditional check 'upgrade_composable_scenario' failed. The
   error was: error while evaluating
   conditional (upgrade_composable_scenario): 'scenario001' is
   undefined

A working idiom here would be to test for non empty string as casting
value doesn't work.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/70/546670/18/experimental/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-multinode-ffu-upgrade/bd302c3/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-02-28_19_37_59_802230

Change-Id: Id6b9ef30f00cb4eef2cdf43110bd111e38e40084

commit_message:
Write only defined variables

If variable is not defined, it failes with set -u as
~/tripleo-ci/scripts/common_functions.sh: line 378: !VAR: unbound variable

This patch adds conditional logic to write only what's defined

Change-Id: Ibd1e7cc9eeb67b3dfdfc3b72af368c9c6796fb18

commit_message:
Revert "openstackdocstheme 1.19.0"

This reverts commit 2a38119e3c4b0eefacc47c02f52cd9e1990090a8.
It failed post-jobs (preventing the tag from happening) and
will need to be reenqueued).

Change-Id: I79daff0acae80ff39f37eb3d41e903417c2cc7fe

commit_message:
Use aio_basekit scenario for OpenSUSE

The aio_basekit scenario is helping the CentOS tests complete
more often and this could help the OpenSUSE tests as well.
This patch adds a non-voting gate test for OpenSUSE using the
aio_basekit scenario. It also disables the existing OpenSUSE
tests since they time out frequently.

Conflicts:
     zuul.d/project.yaml

Change-Id: Ib4a80f7c67518029adf7c6c7bca7d4a95f3f43c9

[{'created': '2018-03-02 20:21:09.000000000', 'message': "CentOS 7 integrated gate optimization

The CentOS 7 AIO jobs time out fairly frequently in the gates and
this patch switches the jobs to use the new aio_basekit scenario in
the hopes that jobs will complete more often.

This patch also sets SELinux to Permissive mode for CentOS 7 gate
testing. This can be changed back to Enforcing when CentOS 7's
SELinux policies are ready.

This patch also sets package_state to present for CentOS 7 jobs. This
is a temporary measure to ensure more of the gate jobs can finish on

commit_message:
CentOS 7 integrated gate optimization

The CentOS 7 AIO jobs time out fairly frequently in the gates and
this patch switches the jobs to use the new aio_basekit scenario in
the hopes that jobs will complete more often.

This patch also sets SELinux to Permissive mode for CentOS 7 gate
testing. This can be changed back to Enforcing when CentOS 7's
SELinux policies are ready.

This patch also sets package_state to present for CentOS 7 jobs. This
is a temporary measure to ensure more of the gate jobs can finish on
time and we can expose deployment issues in the gates.

(This backport fixes a cherry-pick conflict in project.yaml.)

Change-Id: Ic478a7402fee3df0667f0d6fd9a714688808b2ec
(cherry picked from commit f4bc81cff97e943a28d89213305e80f5a5ccac79)

* Job scheduling can be done in-repo for project specific changes,

Read the above mentioned document for finer details.

Please decide whether this change is still needed and then adopt if
for Zuul v3 or abandon it.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-03-05 16:53:44.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

[{'created': '2018-02-24 17:09:45.000000000', 'message': "Implement always tag for required fact

The fact set for 'Set image index fact' is used
in the next task, which is tagged 'always' but
the fact setting is not. This breaks when using
tags.

Given that all the tasks in this file are set to
'always', this patch moves the tag setting to
the inclusion instead.

Change-Id: If319e749ef7cdfbbbd3d03096608fc736927f89d
"}]
commit_message:
Implement always tag for required fact

The fact set for 'Set image index fact' is used
in the next task, which is tagged 'always' but
the fact setting is not. This breaks when using
tags.

Given that all the tasks in this file are set to
'always', this patch moves the tag setting to
the inclusion instead.

Change-Id: If319e749ef7cdfbbbd3d03096608fc736927f89d

subject: Resource Class Affinity
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 1063, 'name': 'Ed Leafe', 'email': 'ed@leafe.com', 'username': 'ed-leafe'}, {'_account_id': 9708, 'name': 'Balazs Gibizer', 'display_name': 'gibi', 'email': 'gibizer@gmail.com', 'username': 'gibi'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25625, 'name': 'Tetsuro Nakamura', 'email': 'tetsuro.nakamura.bc@hco.ntt.co.jp', 'username': 'tetsuro0907'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-02-10 01:03:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-02-12 14:58:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(13 comments)

I'm not supportive of this particular solution. I think a simpler solution for simple NUMA node affinity use cases would be to not involve aggregates at all and use the nested resource providers tree model to describe the structure of trees of resource providers and use the existing proposed granular request groups functionality to describe a request for resources that must be constrained to a single tree (or single provider)."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-02-12 16:50:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(13 comments)

> I think a simpler solution for simple NUMA node affinity use cases would be to not involve aggregates at all and use the nested resource providers tree model to describe the structure of trees of resource providers and use the existing proposed granular request groups functionality to describe a request for resources that must be constrained to a single tree (or single provider).

The reason that doesn't work is that numbered request groups constrain to a single provider, not a (sub)tree.  If a NUMA node's resources can all be provided by a single RP, that's fine.  But (see examples in the doc) that breaks down when e.g. NIC ports are included in the NUMA node.

We need some mechanism to identify a group of providers as belonging to a single NUMA node.  Aggregates aren't the only possibility.  But (I believe) they're the simplest.  No new tables are necessary.  The amount of new syntax is trivial.  The semantic is easy to understand (or so I thought - I'm telling myself you're too close to the forest to see the "trees" :P ).

Though the "Numbered Request Group Affinity" alternative is really growing on me.  That doesn't even require aggregates.  It's just a little harder to grasp.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-02-12 17:10:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Though the "Numbered Request Group Affinity" alternative is really growing on me.  That doesn't even require aggregates.

Duh, sorry, wrong - it still requires aggregates.

But it's still growing on me.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-02-12 17:16:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-02-12 18:10:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-02-12 18:49:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-02-14 13:36:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Wanted to ack that I've read this but also say that I've got no conclusion.

It does seem like being able to express "in the same subtree" _somehow_ is something we'll want to do _eventually_. It's not clear if aggregates is that way to do that or not but I certainly like the idea of not adding more entities/concepts into the system. Aggregates would also mean we can expand beyond a subtree, but I'm not sure I understand the use cases for that[1].

Is "shares an ancestor" something we can easily express in SQL? By easily I mean something newcomers to the code might be able to grok with something less than big effort.

In the meantime, I suspect we can put this off for a while and let expressing nested-ness, in client and server mature and evolve a bit and use that to inform later work?

[1] I think it might be useful for us to make an etherpad or something that expresses some of the use cases that we have pending. I tend to get lost in a lot of the discussion (especially when trying to catch up with irc logs) because there's so much that needs to be drawn from memory to get the full picture, and my memory just isn't that good, at least not every day.'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-02-15 14:38:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I originally thought the purpose of this was a sort of "soft fit" for NUMA: give me all this stuff from the same NUMA node, but if you can't, make sure all resources are from the same parent/root provider. Now that I've read the back-and-forth between you and Jay, I don't really understand what this is accomplishing. The "treeness" of the NUMA node relationship should work with the proposed NRP design; the only thing needed is perhaps adding a trait to indicate a particular RP is a NUMA node.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-02-19 10:46:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-02-19 14:08:10.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

There's fundamental disagreement with this approach.  I'll be interested to see how we end up filling this need."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-10 01:03:19.000000000', 'message': 'Resource Class Affinity

This spec describes a limited but simple mechanism to support modeling
and exploiting NUMA via placement. The design does not attempt to solve
the entire issue of affinity and anti-affinity. Rather, it allows us to
address the majority of use cases in a way that‚Äôs easy to understand,
model, and use; and which does not restrict future development of an
all-encompassing generic affinity/anti-affinity solution.

The crux is the ability to declare, within a request for allocation
candidates, a list of resource classes whose resources must come from
providers in the same aggregate. Virt drivers implementing
update_provider_tree model each NUMA node as a branch off of the root
provider, associating each provider in the branch with a single
aggregate. Operators design flavors containing the list of the resource
classes which must come from the same NUMA node. The scheduler passes
that list to placement, which returns only allocation candidates which
conform to that restriction.

Change-Id: Ibab68cba3b2b38470676e7f7049d0c6610a4d937
blueprint: resource-class-affinity
'}]
commit_message:
Resource Class Affinity

This spec describes a limited but simple mechanism to support modeling
and exploiting NUMA via placement. The design does not attempt to solve
the entire issue of affinity and anti-affinity. Rather, it allows us to
address the majority of use cases in a way that‚Äôs easy to understand,
model, and use; and which does not restrict future development of an
all-encompassing generic affinity/anti-affinity solution.

The crux is the ability to declare, within a request for allocation
candidates, a list of resource classes whose resources must come from
providers in the same aggregate. Virt drivers implementing
update_provider_tree model each NUMA node as a branch off of the root
provider, associating each provider in the branch with a single
aggregate. Operators design flavors containing the list of the resource
classes which must come from the same NUMA node. The scheduler passes
that list to placement, which returns only allocation candidates which
conform to that restriction.

Change-Id: Ibab68cba3b2b38470676e7f7049d0c6610a4d937
blueprint: resource-class-affinity

commit_message:
Form Upgrade SIG

As a result of conversations across multiple PTG's and Forums
there is a consensus that a SIG to focus on improving the process
for upgrading OpenStack clouds would be a good idea.

Change-Id: Ic60aaa5b993a35de5103b93375784accee7a4fbe

commit_message:
Remove now unused jobs from various sahara repositories

Most of jobs from sahara, sahara-tests, python-saharaclient have been
migrated. Keep the ones still not ported (grenade) or not working
(multinode) as Zuul v3.

The native jobs works on stable/pike, stable/queens and master.
Ocata is going out of support in few days
and a last release for Sahara was tagged few days ago.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/546695
Change-Id: I72e9e6ea9d612a40085635544215f89d9b75053e

commit_message:
Make combined and correct acls for openstacksdk team

The shade and sdk teams have merged, but the original implementation of
this in the ACLs was to just make openstacksdk-core include shade-core.
os-client-config has also been merged, and requestsexceptions is a
deliverable of the team too.

Go ahead and collapse them into a single acl file and apply it to all
the projects. Also remove the -release team as openstacksdk is release
managed.

Update the ACL file to match what it should be for a release-managed
project, including stable-maint and branch-release teams.

Update the description - that wiki page isn't really a thing we
care about.

Change-Id: I45364a382fbed7bbadbecd29aa6ff051fecdb895

[{'created': '2018-03-02 15:12:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix up amulet for queens

* Fix up amulet tests to use keystone v3 clients.
* Remove admin_* and auth_* for Queens l3_agent and metadata

commit_message:
Fix up amulet for queens

* Fix up amulet tests to use keystone v3 clients.
* Remove admin_* and auth_* for Queens l3_agent and metadata
  config files as they no longer appears to be used.
* charm helper sync

Change-Id: I880b7f710fa6b5ba480fb41d4095871fd9dabed7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-23 12:39:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix broken validations on stack update

Patch I3be30ed8bb61d8ed514991a2f55c5c4e36c56411 fixed a confusing
message on initial deploy (bug #1703942) but broke stack update for
cases when there are no extra free nodes available (even though they
are not needed).

This patch reverts the earlier one and fixes the confusing message in
an alternative way -- we first validate available node count (a
validation for this already exists), and only if it succeeds we
proceed to validate the availability of nodes matching particular
flavors.

Change-Id: I91ddc03e5ac22494f5276f08f87011074483d5c6
Closes-Bug: #1745997
Related-Bug: #1703942
'}]
commit_message:
Fix broken validations on stack update

Patch I3be30ed8bb61d8ed514991a2f55c5c4e36c56411 fixed a confusing
message on initial deploy (bug #1703942) but broke stack update for
cases when there are no extra free nodes available (even though they
are not needed).

This patch reverts the earlier one and fixes the confusing message in
an alternative way -- we first validate available node count (a
validation for this already exists), and only if it succeeds we
proceed to validate the availability of nodes matching particular
flavors.

Change-Id: I91ddc03e5ac22494f5276f08f87011074483d5c6
Closes-Bug: #1745997
Related-Bug: #1703942

commit_message:
Remove newton job from projects pipeline

newton is EOL now and tempest has newton jobs
running on check pipeline as voting.

d-g also have newton job running.

Tempest also going to mark end of support of newton
in Tempest (Depends-On patch).

Though newton EOl cleanup is pending on job side
but let's remove these from tempest and d-g pipeline
where tempest has this job voting and can cause issue
if no newton branches etc.

This commit also remove below job as there is no stable/newton branch
in Tempest so it does not run anywhere.
- legacy-tempest-dsvm-nnet-newton

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/546906/
Change-Id: I69a6af9f79606c02d898c5d76c92c60ed17bd5fa

commit_message:
Release 1.27.1 of shade

This contains a small but important bugfix that fixes a regression
introduced in the inventory used by the openshift-ansible folks for
their openstack integration.

Change-Id: I10c1fc67256d3533de1d204f06fdc500a76454e5
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/548702

commit_message:
make add_release_notes_links.sh smarter

When everything is fine, say so.

When the project doesn't publish any release notes at all, don't
report that the series page is missing.

Change-Id: I122675d63c45a643af74a62ee42de1977ddc9ea6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
set up logging for propose-final-releases

Several of the support modules now use logging exclusively as a way to
emit debug info. Set up logging so we can see that debug info when
--verbose is turned on.

Change-Id: I029b6cc8667fca61f70afd19e99dd865870a546e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Skip diff-start for first final release tagging

Handles the case where it is the first release of a deliverable.
Instead of adding 'none' as the diff-start, this just skips
adding the setting to the release.

Change-Id: I66fd4ef165165689cb6d2b6613c45b3564330a8f

subject: un-EOL Ocata
messages: [{'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-02-28 17:42:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-28 18:03:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-03-05 14:34:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-28 17:42:56.000000000', 'message': "un-EOL Ocata

In the release-cycles/Support length discussion at the PTG we (mostly)
all agreeed to keep Ocata around for another 6 months so remove the EOL
tag and set the clock ticking.

It looks strange that we only extended Ocata but it's the first step in
a longer process that will probably still be on-going at the Berlin
summit

Change-Id: Ib09b27eff0e6ef94ddf4a1f6291b16b4a1b40c8c
"}]
commit_message:
un-EOL Ocata

In the release-cycles/Support length discussion at the PTG we (mostly)
all agreeed to keep Ocata around for another 6 months so remove the EOL
tag and set the clock ticking.

It looks strange that we only extended Ocata but it's the first step in
a longer process that will probably still be on-going at the Berlin
summit

Change-Id: Ib09b27eff0e6ef94ddf4a1f6291b16b4a1b40c8c

commit_message:
Add more usage hints

Since there's already a hint on how to tell the bot to book a room,
and some people have been slightly struggling with updating track
info, add a couple of hints making it more obvious how to do this
without having to consult a larger README.rst.  This should hopefully
encourage more people to help keep track info up to date.

Also include a link to the nicely rendered version of README.rst on
GitHub, so that if people are looking for more detailed help, they can
easily find it.

Change-Id: I3596d69dc84b635bc3a67ff7223a7ccfad27308e

commit_message:
use common agent topics from neutron-lib

The neutron.common.topics module was rehomed into neutron-lib with
commit Ie88b84949cbd55a4e7ad06341aab77b286cdc485
This patch consumes it by using neutron-lib's version of the module in
prep for Ia4a4604c259ce862597de80c6deeb3d408bf0e95

Change-Id: Ibcb76290f46d4fcf82ba62bb2e1694f98fffa13e

commit_message:
Define devstack-base abstract job

Define an abstract job devstack base that does not require any
project apart from devstack. This job defines basic devstack_localrc
settings that are common to any devstack job (mostly to work with
infra) and devstack_services to emit "disable_all_services" so to
cancel any devstack default.

The variables are defined as global ones as well as host-vars for
the controller and group-vars for peer nodes, so that any
descendent job may extend them, thanks for Zuul dict merging.

Change-Id: I2cdb723f6ee209683044fecec59ff7b510a2752b

commit_message:
Restore NEUTRON_CREATE_INITIAL_NETWORKS flag

Somehow this feature was lost in the transition
from q-svc to neutron-api. This patch does not
modify the default behavior but allows specifying
the flag to false to prevent devstack from creating
the public and private networks.

Change-Id: I952672496d007552c0c4d83db0d0df9be50326fc
Signed-off-by: Josh <jhershbe@redhat.com>

commit_message:
set network-feature-enabled.port_security to True

tempest.api.volume.test_volumes_snapshots.VolumesSnapshotTestJSON.
test_snapshot_create_offline_delete needs port_security feature.
In tempest, It is disabled by default. We need to enable in order
to run this tests.

Change-Id: I63e4cb2ff7a9af3d1d16f57c9e4245e4b0f92395
Closes-Bug: #1753370

XenAPI reports the max_display_heads in vgpu_stats. This commit
is to create inventory data for vGPU display heads in compute
node, so that we can support scheduling resource providers basing
on the VGPU_DISPLAY_HEAD.
The total vGPU display heads = (max heads per vGPU) * total_vgpus

commit_message:
XenAPI: provide VGPU_DISPLAY_HEAD inventory in compute node

XenAPI reports the max_display_heads in vgpu_stats. This commit
is to create inventory data for vGPU display heads in compute
node, so that we can support scheduling resource providers basing
on the VGPU_DISPLAY_HEAD.
The total vGPU display heads = (max heads per vGPU) * total_vgpus

blueprint: add-support-for-vgpu

Change-Id: I6862ce67c7ae62fbea5816075c16b7e428e1c36e

commit_message:
Update role SHA's to include additional fixes

There've been some role updates since the last SHA bump. To
ensure that these are available in the next (and possibly
final) release, we update the SHA's to the latest.

Change-Id: I62436ad46a1ca672b39812a3370e768cdb2c9c92

[{'created': '2017-10-23 22:43:56.000000000', 'message': 'Remove jenkins from DIB images

There is no jenkins, only zuul! With zuulv3 running in production,
there is no more need to add jenkins user or scripts to our images.

Change-Id: Ia9750877fbc1a17ec467ca4ac685afdb9c1627f8
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove jenkins-slave element from DIB images

There is no jenkins, only zuul! With zuulv3 running in production,
there is no more need to add jenkins user or scripts to our images.

Move chmod of /opt/cache/files from
nodepool/elements/jenkins-slave/install.d/20-jenkins-slave to
nodepool/elements/zuul-worker/install.d/60-zuul-worker

We also leave the jenkins-slave elements for now, in case 3rd party CI
use them.

Change-Id: Ia9750877fbc1a17ec467ca4ac685afdb9c1627f8
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Good bye jenkins/scripts

We now only have afs-slug.sh in jenkins/scripts/ and it is only
used by nodepool/scripts/configure_mirror.sh. Move the file into the
nodepool/scripts directory and adjust paths.

Remove copying of jenkins/scripts from nodepool, the directory does not
exist anymore.

Remove 89-jenkins-scripts, we don't need it anymore.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/548393
Change-Id: I13cac791d70a2e5bcb0de1ba0adcd79e1b0aee9f

commit_message:
Enable py35 unit test job

To enable py35 for the functional test job, we'll first
need to move legacy-osc-placement-dsvm-functional in-tree
and then we can copy it and enable py35.

Change-Id: I81f62f24996522fd4a16c8486920795bc221495d

commit_message:
Run local script after nova cellsv2 is configured

If user try to create a server in local script before nova cells is
configured, it will run into the following error:
Host 'x' is not mapped to any cell.

Change-Id: I4fe76865fd6e16d5beb5ed9e5d6a9f3542e990a5

commit_message:
Update nova api_class setting to backend

Castellan switches the `api_class` config option to `backend`. The change
is still backwards compatible with the old `api_class` setting, but cinder
already updated to use the new option (see I5e46c738531d5d56777e91a00f4cee9531356f2e)
and it is better to use the new setting.

Change-Id: Ib609c82e7076d19676baaf4f08abd79ea11db0e3

commit_message:
Increse api_max_retries and api_retry_interval for ironic

There is no way to upgrade ironic before nova because of
grenade design. In multinode job we do not restart nova
as we test partial upgrade of ironic there.
On slow nodes upgrading ironic takes time and nova looses
ironic connectivity

This patch increases api_retry_interval and api_max_retries
to make sure we have a time to upgrade ironic before nova
compute stuck.

Change-Id: I3b1429d6561431a82edda04a0e574cac38771837

commit_message:
Move platform jobs to zuulv3 native

We've called the jobs that don't run on our main Ubuntu targets
"platform" jobs; start at moving these jobs to native jobs.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/541010

Change-Id: Ib64d91206a9ac677f4d77873bc54c6a84702d6c3

commit_message:
Run swift-container-sync under run_process

All the evidence from [1] suggests that on opensuse swift-init is not
detaching the daemon process correctly.  It's possible there's a pipe
still in play that somehow holds our ansible-streamer open.

This is a minimal fix to avoid swift-init.  Although it's possible in
non-default paths to still use swift-init (and hence possibly hit
another variant of this issue), after discussions with swift
developers it was decided the intersection of tests running under our
current ansible, on suse, that would enable these services is
sufficiently small that this is the best course for now.

[1] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2001528

Change-Id: I1b68c08c07cf6653ea58506f738cbe0054b38f3a

commit_message:
Move release-tools out of jenkins/scripts

To not install these on the images, create a new scripts directory to
hold them.

Create new copy-release-tools-scripts role to copy the files over,
we do not need using legacy-copy-project-config-scripts anymore since
everything is copied elsewhere.

Add the role to all playbooks that use release-tools scripts.

Change-Id: I36c458e297fec58023799f625739b341c4d403cf

commit_message:
Don't load config from github projects

These could wedge our config if we aren't careful, and we aren't
loading jobs from them right now, so be as conservative as possible.

Change-Id: I23bea968875ecb12f8cec5f81277cf3f3071f4f8

The k8s-sig would like to experiment with the idea of creating a base
job to install kubernetes.  By adding kubernetes-incubator/kubespray

commit_message:
Add kubernetes-incubator/kubespray into zuul tenant

The k8s-sig would like to experiment with the idea of creating a base
job to install kubernetes.  By adding kubernetes-incubator/kubespray
to zuul's configuration, we'll be able to run their playbooks / roles
directly from a zuul-executor.

Change-Id: If2ea5f4211d1bca00e35b641e17f1e958079beb3
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2018-03-02 09:41:35.000000000', 'message': 'WIP use deterministic shard names

TODO: unit tests, docstring changes, plumb account prefix from config

Before, shard range container names were based on their upper bound. Now
they are based on their index so that any process finding N shard ranges
in potentially dissimilar replicas of a container will use the same shard
continer names.

Change-Id: I8cf5d72a9256ee2bae141ebdb892db2cb578f39a
'}, {'created': '2018-03-03 10:19:32.000000000', 'message': "Use deterministic shard names, use configured account prefix

Before, shard range container names were based on their upper
bound. Now they are based on their index so that any process finding N
shard ranges in potentially dissimilar replicas of a container will
use the same shard container names.

Before, the shard containers' account prefix was fixed as
'.sharded_'. Now it is '<prefix>shards_' where <prefix> is the
configurable autocreate account prefix.

Usually only one process would be expected to find shard
ranges. However, if more than one process is finding shard ranges
then, assuming they are using the same epoch and shard range number,
they will now create the same shard range containers. Each process is
likely to select different bounds for those shard ranges, but boundary
disputes can be resolved during replication. The fact that each
process created the same shard container means that only object rows
close to boundaries will need to be relocated.

A shard container name has the form:

  <root-container-name>-H(parent-container-name)-<epoch>-<index>

where H is the md5 hash function.

The hash of the parent container is included to differentiate shards
of shard-x and shard-y if shard-x and shard-y were to be sharded at
the same epoch.

For example, the second shard range of a root container named 'foo'
would have container name:

  shard-name = foo-H(foo)-<epoch>-1

The third shard-range of that shard would have name:

  foo-H(shard-name)-<epoch>-2

Change-Id: I8cf5d72a9256ee2bae141ebdb892db2cb578f39a
"}, {'created': '2018-03-03 10:32:06.000000000', 'message': "Use deterministic shard names, use configured account prefix

commit_message:
Use deterministic shard names, use configured account prefix

Before, shard range container names were based on their upper
bound. Now they are based on their index so that any process finding N
shard ranges in potentially dissimilar replicas of a container will
use the same shard container names.

Before, the shard containers' account prefix was fixed as
'.sharded_'. Now it is '<prefix>shards_' where <prefix> is the
configurable autocreate account prefix.

Usually only one process would be expected to find shard
ranges. However, if more than one process is finding shard ranges
then, assuming they are using the same epoch and shard range number,
they will now create the same shard range containers. Each process is
likely to select different bounds for those shard ranges, but boundary
disputes can be resolved during replication. The fact that each
process created the same shard container means that only object rows
close to boundaries will need to be relocated.

A shard container name has the form:

  <root-container-name>-H(parent-container-name)-<epoch>-<index>

where H is the md5 hash function.

The hash of the parent container is included to differentiate shards
of shard-x and shard-y if shard-x and shard-y were to be sharded at
the same epoch.

For example, the second shard range of a root container named 'foo'
would have container name:

  shard-name = foo-H(foo)-<epoch>-1

The third shard-range of that shard would have name:

  foo-H(shard-name)-<epoch>-2

Change-Id: I8cf5d72a9256ee2bae141ebdb892db2cb578f39a

commit_message:
Move instance attribute defined into "__init__" method

1. Define instance attribute in instance method is not a good idea,
when invoke the method, it will set attribute, it is unnecessary,
this ps move the attribute defined into __init__ method, and
and let the list_engines() just list the engines.
2. Update the description of EngineManager.

Change-Id: I3c9af9cf265cb44d6db4d2f3690b6ddb92fdd61e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-01 11:26:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix nova db post setup tasks to remove race

If the nova_db_post_setup.yml task is delegated to the same conductor
host for multiple compute hosts, the tasks run in parallel. If the
nova_db_post_setup.yml task is delegated to different conductor hosts,
the tasks run in serial. When the tasks run in parallel this creates a
race condition which can cause the "Perform a cell_v2 discover" task to
fail due to multiple tasks attempting to make the same changes to the
database.

The tasks in nova_db_post_setup.yml should only need to be run once for
the new compute hosts, not for each one. This change limits the tasks to
running once to prevent the possibility of conflicting database
changes being attempted.

Change-Id: I216d781f129d4d56ad10405b9f4a55f7a3fd597a
Closes-bug: 1752540
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nova db post setup tasks to remove race

If the nova_db_post_setup.yml task is delegated to the same conductor
host for multiple compute hosts, the tasks run in parallel. If the
nova_db_post_setup.yml task is delegated to different conductor hosts,
the tasks run in serial. When the tasks run in parallel this creates a
race condition which can cause the "Perform a cell_v2 discover" task to
fail due to multiple tasks attempting to make the same changes to the
database.

The tasks in nova_db_post_setup.yml should only need to be run once for
the new compute hosts, not for each one. This change limits the tasks to
running once to prevent the possibility of conflicting database
changes being attempted.

Change-Id: I216d781f129d4d56ad10405b9f4a55f7a3fd597a
Closes-bug: 1752540

commit_message:
Provide service domain id for v3 deployments

The glance swift store configuration requires use of the domain
id for the service domain; update data set for identity-service
relation to include service_domain_id.

Change-Id: Ie6e2733f34de10a4d34b18dbf1fd9ba623af0e18
Closes-Bug: 1752027

commit_message:
Remvoved OvS2.5 specific changes as it is no longer required

In pike release, we have migrated manifests from ovs2.5 to ovs2.6 and
retained the backward compatibility. Removing the ovs2.5 changes
in this cycle as it is no longer used.

Change-Id: I286b2f4d090dda34ec95f24f77baefcb7687ff85

commit_message:
Models are no longer 'types'

In jsonmodels, the metaclass for models was changed. Therefore, a model
is no longer a type. Checks of the form type(x) == type fail, and are
replaced with inspect.isclass(x).

Change-Id: Ib8de32e47db8b44735c95b552835ce85b24e2b88
Closes-Bug: #1753244

commit_message:
Fix manila endpoint in catalog not find error

This issue occurs when we list share without add manilav1 endpoint,
there will be "could not find Manila endpoint in catalog".

Since manilav1 has been deprecated for a couple of releases, so there
is no need to add manilav1 endpoint when using manila v2 API.

This change is to fix it without add manilav1 endpoint, we can also
perform manila command with manilav2 endpoint when using manila v2
API.

Change-Id: I68b499e153e1aba3a5a285f07d71e31b6af65bca
Closes-Bug: #1558995
Closes-Bug: #1734016

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary distribution determination

The need for the distribution was removed in I249f21a98fea3b963b7ffb8e3d0fce02cc540d46
so we can remove the code around that was determining it but not
actually making use of it anywhere anymore.

Change-Id: I572943bbc0c2665a885b7a80cdb2d1817c61bc3c

subject: Fix manila logging rabbitmq password in debug mode
messages:
[{'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-03-04 11:44:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/queens.'}, {'account_id': 21863, 'date': '2018-03-04 12:42:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Build failed.  To recheck use 'run-INFINIDAT'.  For 3rd party ci contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems

- dsvm-tempest-manila-infinibox http://openstack-ci-logs.aws.infinidat.com/96/549596/1/check/dsvm-tempest-manila-infinibox/ebdff82 : FAILURE in 57m 29s"}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-03-05 02:19:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-03-05 06:51:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-04 11:44:19.000000000', 'message': "Fix manila logging rabbitmq password in debug mode

Manila will display the rabbitmq password if debugging is enabled.
This patch will ensure that the rabbitmq password is no longer
displayed in the connection log for Manila when debugging is
enabled by looking for the rabbitmq key and not printing it.

There should likely be an effort to utilize Oslo's secret flag for
options to truly fix this issue for this and other sensitive options.

Change-Id: I97cc88354d9b54057350c70c4742055197540d1a
Closes-Bug: 1750074
(cherry picked from commit 05e4f14ea1fbc7ce61c8f57a082080d09c63e357)
(cherry picked from commit be8580b350c34c91494cb553eb15e6b61ef250b7)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix manila logging rabbitmq password in debug mode

Manila will display the rabbitmq password if debugging is enabled.
This patch will ensure that the rabbitmq password is no longer
displayed in the connection log for Manila when debugging is
enabled by looking for the rabbitmq key and not printing it.

There should likely be an effort to utilize Oslo's secret flag for
options to truly fix this issue for this and other sensitive options.

Change-Id: I97cc88354d9b54057350c70c4742055197540d1a
Closes-Bug: 1750074
(cherry picked from commit 05e4f14ea1fbc7ce61c8f57a082080d09c63e357)
(cherry picked from commit be8580b350c34c91494cb553eb15e6b61ef250b7)

subject: kuryr will cleanup port device_id when docker disconnect
messages: [{'account_id': 27701, 'date': '2018-02-26 08:54:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-02-26 23:02:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nThis is not related to this patch but it is a bug in kuryr that it wipes the device_id when the Zun container is restarted: https://bugs.launchpad.net/zun/+bug/1751933 . Therefore, I think a better approach would be changing kuryr to avoid wiping the device_id if it is set externally by Zun. Then, Zun is responsible to do the cleanup of the device_id.'}, {'account_id': 27701, 'date': '2018-03-02 05:03:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-03-03 03:13:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27701, 'date': '2018-03-05 07:30:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-26 08:54:25.000000000', 'message': 'kuryr will cleanup port device_id when docker disconnect

Change-Id: Id59c23e6214440e55e38e425f6494080d06fe1c6
'}, {'created': '2018-03-02 05:03:36.000000000', 'message': 'kuryr will cleanup port device_id when docker disconnect

Change-Id: Id59c23e6214440e55e38e425f6494080d06fe1c6
Implements: blueprint zun-do-not-need-to-cleanup-port
'}]
commit_message:
kuryr will cleanup port device_id when docker disconnect

Change-Id: Id59c23e6214440e55e38e425f6494080d06fe1c6
Implements: blueprint zun-do-not-need-to-cleanup-port

commit_message:
Update pypowervm min to 1.1.11

1.1.11 is required for a proposed PowerVM virt driver change [1].

This version also removes the dependency on networkx [2] as a
necessary step toward OpenStack supporting networkx 2.0 [3].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541387
[2] https://github.com/powervm/pypowervm/issues/4
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-requirements/+bug/1718576

Change-Id: I9932168c93fb53498fdcd093f8c5f42e35870dd4

commit_message:
Add reno for manila generic driver removal

A recent change [1] removed dysfunctional environment templates
for manila with the "generic" back end.  Add a release note for
same.

[1] I2e1db2bd614eae65e59712f50dc3391f16f6b388

Change-Id: Iaca0250361055d5175fc93814334cd393e959395
(cherry picked from commit ee0521b25a8411fcf00b651b8f50567dac1b0f82)

commit_message:
Add base kit scenario

This scenario includes only the base compute kit (and haproxy),
consisting of: Glance, Keystone, Neutron, Nova and Cinder.

Change-Id: I40e6901ef116b3f4a8d24ad1851327d83a56323e
(cherry picked from commit 72f46e7464c4e4ebfdba2e43492115631a5efc6b)

[{'created': '2018-02-21 08:35:25.000000000', 'message': 'Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines
they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

Change-Id: I9241f126114beae077079aba5c25c2afda517068

they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines
they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/

Change-Id: I9241f126114beae077079aba5c25c2afda517068

The change itself is fine once you split into two parts'}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2018-02-27 22:41:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-02-28 07:17:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-03-05 03:24:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-27 04:51:21.000000000', 'message': 'Remove requests-mock

requests-mock was always a general purpose python library, however as it
was initially developed in the openstack community it was hosted there
to take advantage of the infrastructure.

At this time with its developers spending less time on OpenStack it is
felt that being behind gerrit is limiting contributions (even without
the CLA) as more outside contributions are received by launchpad
attachment than gerrit.

The project will continue development at
https://github.com/jamielennox/requests-mock

Depends-On: Ic554437cf34fda7211ddfd2bb9d5f799f80a3096

commit_message:
Stop requests-mock jobs for retirement

requests-mock was always a general purpose python library, however as it
was initially developed in the openstack community it was hosted there
to take advantage of the infrastructure.

At this time with its developers spending less time on OpenStack it is
felt that being behind gerrit is limiting contributions (even without
the CLA) as more outside contributions are received by launchpad
attachment than gerrit.

The project will continue development at
https://github.com/jamielennox/requests-mock

Remove the zuul jobs in accordance with:
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

Change-Id: I7e88b9fc68f83b8a37b99e62f207dbd648a114e4

commit_message:
Pass located tests directory in oslo debug

According to [1], we can passing a "-t" argument to
oslo_debug_helper to indicate the directory where tests
are located. This will solves ImportError exception.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Change-Id: I94802af0b0877c952c8270bc4129c2a01aa2e40f
Closes-Bug: #1666560

commit_message:
Removes manila-generic-config from TripleO

Generic driver is not intended to be used in real environments
since it introduces a SPOF in the data path. Due to this, it
doesn't make sense and generates confusion to have the environment
file, so in this patch set we simply remove it.

Change-Id: I2e1db2bd614eae65e59712f50dc3391f16f6b388
Closes-Bug: #1708680
(cherry picked from commit 6740f94914606ed02328cd557489afae16c04e20)
(cherry picked from commit 6a25b212da4f40303b40804f8e815edd42add1aa)

[{'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2014-11-16 07:44:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2014-11-16 07:45:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-11-16 08:01:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-heat-templates-dsvm http://logs.openstack.org/49/134749/2/check/gate-heat-templates-dsvm/4552b04 : FAILURE in 14m 07s (non-voting)
- gate-heat-templates-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/49/134749/2/check/gate-heat-templates-pep8/99a7265 : SUCCESS in 26s (non-voting)
- gate-heat-templates-python26 http://logs.openstack.org/49/134749/2/check/gate-heat-templates-python26/cb2edb8 : FAILURE in 28s (non-voting)
- gate-heat-templates-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/49/134749/2/check/gate-heat-templates-python27/8e6c5b9 : FAILURE in 28s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2014-11-17 11:16:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

Thanks, we definitely do need an example of SoftwareDeployments, and this looks like a nice simple one to start with.

Couple of comments re the content of the config being applied.

Also, related to my comments, I don't really get why using python is related to exit(0), you can just use exit in bash?"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2014-11-17 11:16:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2014-11-17 13:30:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

@shardy, thanks for the comments.

Please check my comments inline.

exit(0) is not strictly required in this example, so I'm removing it. The reason I had it there is that it could be a common error where template authors failed to indicate a success to software config.

Will commit another patchset soon."}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2014-11-17 13:37:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-11-17 13:53:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-heat-templates-dsvm http://logs.openstack.org/49/134749/3/check/gate-heat-templates-dsvm/161337a : FAILURE in 14m 36s (non-voting)
- gate-heat-templates-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/49/134749/3/check/gate-heat-templates-pep8/a844caa : SUCCESS in 37s (non-voting)
- gate-heat-templates-python26 http://logs.openstack.org/49/134749/3/check/gate-heat-templates-python26/e580fdb : SUCCESS in 32s (non-voting)
- gate-heat-templates-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/49/134749/3/check/gate-heat-templates-python27/60a8a60 : SUCCESS in 25s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2014-11-17 14:44:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2014-11-17 14:49:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@shardy, in the new patchset (3), I'm passing in a dictionary.  That is why I proposed a change to enable script hook to handle 'Json' data type."}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2014-11-17 14:50:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I'm still of the opinion that the python snippet is confusing, and the eval usage is concerning.

FWIW, I see template examples as best to contain the minimum to demonstrate the functionality, and in this case we have a config with group "script" which then has a python script exposing internal interface details of some stuff normally only considered by the hook scripts (which, confusingly, are python scripts).

So all things considered, I'd rather replace it with one line of bash.  You can use "tee" if you want to print to stdout and a file simultaneously.

Feel free to wait for feedback from tspatzier and stevebaker though if you don't agree with my opinion :)'}, {'account_id': 7193, 'date': '2014-11-17 17:10:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

I don't really have a problem with using a python script instead of a bash script. It is not really using internal APIs but just what is available via the environment to any script, no matter what language."}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2014-11-18 01:52:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-11-18 02:08:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-heat-templates-dsvm http://logs.openstack.org/49/134749/4/check/gate-heat-templates-dsvm/9485a4b : SUCCESS in 15m 27s (non-voting)
- gate-heat-templates-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/49/134749/4/check/gate-heat-templates-pep8/90fa04f : SUCCESS in 27s (non-voting)
- gate-heat-templates-python26 http://logs.openstack.org/49/134749/4/check/gate-heat-templates-python26/93119cf : SUCCESS in 29s (non-voting)
- gate-heat-templates-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/49/134749/4/check/gate-heat-templates-python27/4bf93f4 : SUCCESS in 28s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 7193, 'date': '2014-11-18 17:07:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Ok, so regarding the template version thing I mentioned in my last comment, I see that we have in fact two different implementations for get_attr, so that's ok (thanks Qiming for pointing me to it). It still feels a bit confusing to me, but that's another issue.

The -1 is only because I was expecting to see a response to Steven's comment on eval in patch set 3. As for using a python script instead of bash, I am ok as said in my last comment."}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2014-11-19 02:33:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Well, I admit that, in general, 'eval' is a dangerous function that can be exploited.  The reason I was using it in the Python script is that I am passing in something in this form:

"{u'0': u'timestamp 1', u'1': u'timestamp 2'}"

The dict is an input generated from the SoftwareDeployments resource (Line 39).  Parsing this data structure using Bash might unnecessarily complicate the template.  That is why Python was used.  The data structure is not a strict Json (and I cannot convert it to Json in template), so the most straight-forward way to parse it is using 'eval()'.

Regarding the danger it poses to users, I'm hoping that users would be aware of it -- maybe I should leave a comment warning users of this?

Why I'm doing this?  I was trying to exemplify how each server in a group can retrieve its own slice of data based on its resource name.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2014-11-19 09:55:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Qiming: I think you're using eval to work around a bug - the map returned from the resource should be reformatted via the input IMO, as if something is type Json, surely it's a bug if it's not parseable via json.loads?

It seems to me that there should be some format manipulation, such that the inputs are cast where possible based on the schema (e.g type of the input)?

So, by the time the json input hits the script in the VM, it should have the quoting correctly formatted, e.g '{"0": "timestamp 1", "1": "timestamp 2"}'

If you agree, perhaps you can raise a bug, then add a comment in the template warning that eval usage is potentially unsafe, and referencing the bug justifying it's usage as a workaround?'}, {'account_id': 7193, 'date': '2014-11-19 12:10:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thanks for the clarification. I think a comment on what the eval call does, i.e. what the input and expected output is would be helpful so that people can see it without having detail understanding of other resources.'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2014-11-19 14:03:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

Okay, I agree to Steven's suggestion so I am putting this on hold until I can fix the problem of passing Python dictionary around.

The current problem is formatting outputs, where no output carries type information.  I cannot tell whether a string is an encoded JSON."}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2014-11-21 06:46:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-11-21 07:06:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-heat-templates-dsvm http://logs.openstack.org/49/134749/5/check/gate-heat-templates-dsvm/25828a3 : SUCCESS in 15m 17s (non-voting)
- gate-heat-templates-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/49/134749/5/check/gate-heat-templates-pep8/a6b2390 : SUCCESS in 47s (non-voting)
- gate-heat-templates-python26 http://logs.openstack.org/49/134749/5/check/gate-heat-templates-python26/12fd0e2 : SUCCESS in 27s (non-voting)
- gate-heat-templates-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/49/134749/5/check/gate-heat-templates-python27/7f32e8c : SUCCESS in 27s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-03-05 00:41:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}]

commit_message:
Sample template using SoftwareDeployments

This template demonstrates how to use SoftwareDeployments over a group
of servers.  The key points of this template are:

 - the use of '2014-10-16' as the version, or else 'get_attr' won't work
   as expected.
 - the approach to generate 'servers' property for SoftwareDeployments.
 - passing dictionary into server and extract info corresponding to
   current server.

Change-Id: I632799221d42c3e133ee1d162686cb234bd9d549

[{'created': '2017-07-05 16:07:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: If385b1a5ab1452ceaf73c83cbcd7d6853f3a5e82
'}]
commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: If385b1a5ab1452ceaf73c83cbcd7d6853f3a5e82

[{'created': '2017-06-09 06:55:51.000000000', 'message': 'Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3.

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: Id15731280dfb9154687670475518ed990a22e22c
Closes-Bug:#1693670
'}]
commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3.

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: Id15731280dfb9154687670475518ed990a22e22c
Closes-Bug:#1693670

subject: Add fedora-27 devstack / tempest jobs
messages:
[{'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-02-22 18:52:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-02-22 18:59:00.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to fedora-27'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-02-22 19:02:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-02-22 19:37:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-02-22 20:45:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

other option: name these jobs fedora-latest or fedora - so, no need to rename with Fedora 28, just update nodeset.'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-02-22 20:53:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yah, I'm going to bring it up at PTG. I think it is a good idea, however means that we can change fedora version under the nose of jobs.  Which, might catch some projects by surprise. Mostly because, it could me job pass one day on fedora-26 but fail on fedora-27."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-02-22 20:54:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

yeah, not sure what's best - but with Fedora changing so often and distributed configs, this might be the better way..."}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-02-22 21:10:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

agree, I think best if we all agree in infra, then write up something in docs. As they change out every 6 months and could break voting jobs.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-02-22 21:35:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

my preference is to move these to native jobs like Ib64d91206a9ac677f4d77873bc54c6a84702d6c3

the updown job may have no equivalent ATM, i'd have to check but f27 should be running devstack with python3 anyway

but in the mean-time as that gets reviewed, this is ok for mine"}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-02-22 21:48:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-02-23 07:08:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

I don't like adding new legacy jobs - let's get this one converted to native Zuul v3 before we do the dance again..."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-02-23 07:08:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2018-02-23 10:14:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

LGTM, waiting for this patch'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-03-04 21:39:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-22 22:33:06.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve Ansible variable precedence issue with include_vars

This patch effectively works around an issue we're seeing with
Ansible's var precedence with the "include -- with_first_found"
pattern.

What is happening is that a role, configure-unbound, has a "vars"
directory which is meant to be used by an
"include_vars -- with_first_found" task.
However, since we have a "vars" directory at the playbook level, this
directory has precedence over the one in the role. This makes it so
the var files from the playbook directory are included instead of the
one in the role.

We wanted to address that by using {{ role_path }} within roles, but
it turns out that Zuul's protection mechanisms is actually
interfering [1]. Work around this for the time being.

[1]: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23zuul/%23zuul.2018-01-15.log.html#t2018-01-15T22:44:13

Change-Id: Ia79a793200fcb89161783ff641b85106936084b5
'}, {'created': '2018-02-19 19:36:31.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve Ansible variable precedence issue with include_vars

directory has precedence over the one in the role. This makes it so

We wanted to address that by using {{ role_path }} within roles, but

[1]: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23zuul/%23zuul.2018-01-15.log.html#t2018-01-15T22:44:13

Change-Id: Ia79a793200fcb89161783ff641b85106936084b5

'}, {'created': '2018-03-02 16:21:21.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve Ansible variable precedence issue with include_vars

This patch effectively works around an issue we're seeing with
Ansible's var precedence with the "include -- with_first_found"
pattern.

TL;DR of what is happening is that a role, configure-unbound, has a
"vars" directory which is meant to be used by an "include_vars --
with_first_found" task.

However, since we have a "vars" directory at the playbook level, this
directory has precedence over the one in the role. This makes it so
the var files from the playbook directory are included instead of the
one in the role.

We wanted to address that by using {{ role_path }} within roles, but
it turns out that Zuul's protection mechanisms is actually
interfering [1]. Work around this for the time being.

Since this is all not very straightforward, it ought to be documented
properly somewhere -- this is in the README.rst file for the time
being. Let's figure out a better place later.

[1]: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23zuul/%23zuul.2018-01-15.log.html#t2018-01-15T22:44:13

Change-Id: Ia79a793200fcb89161783ff641b85106936084b5
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve Ansible variable precedence issue with include_vars

This patch effectively works around an issue we're seeing with
Ansible's var precedence with the "include -- with_first_found"
pattern.

TL;DR of what is happening is that a role, configure-unbound, has a
"vars" directory which is meant to be used by an "include_vars --
with_first_found" task.

However, since we have a "vars" directory at the playbook level, this
directory has precedence over the one in the role. This makes it so
the var files from the playbook directory are included instead of the
one in the role.

We wanted to address that by using {{ role_path }} within roles, but
it turns out that Zuul's protection mechanisms is actually
interfering [1]. Work around this for the time being.

Since this is all not very straightforward, it ought to be documented
properly somewhere -- this is in the README.rst file for the time
being. Let's figure out a better place later.

[1]: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23zuul/%23zuul.2018-01-15.log.html#t2018-01-15T22:44:13

Change-Id: Ia79a793200fcb89161783ff641b85106936084b5

commit_message:
Update the minimum acceptable pylxd.

Based on discussions on backporting the u-c bump
(I53083e5b2d60724ef51fd5b5e349cd7ecdbc7b6d) it's clear that this is now
the minimum acceptable version so lets make sure we have it right for
master.

Sadly we can't do this on queens :(

Change-Id: I7f8ea9d370c48b14568ac09751b317519c06392e

subject: [openstack] Remove nova hosts specific logic
messages: [{'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-03-04 18:57:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-03-04 19:31:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-04 18:57:26.000000000', 'message': '[openstack] Remove nova hosts specific logic

os-hosts CLIs and python API bindings had been deprecated from
python-novaclient 9.0.0 and finally became removed in 10.0.0 release.

The related scenarios become redundant. We cannot launch then in gates
and it is impossible to ensure that they work even with old novaclient
release. Since it is not something critical and what is called regulary
in old OpenStack environments we should not provide any workaround and
can just remove the os-hosts logic from Rally.

[*] https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/releasenotes/notes/remove-hosts-d08855550c40b9c6.yaml

Change-Id: I915983dbc634dafcab1cc54dba7bae8d4e368884
'}]
commit_message:
[openstack] Remove nova hosts specific logic

os-hosts CLIs and python API bindings had been deprecated from
python-novaclient 9.0.0 and finally became removed in 10.0.0 release.

The related scenarios become redundant. We cannot launch then in gates
and it is impossible to ensure that they work even with old novaclient
release. Since it is not something critical and what is called regulary
in old OpenStack environments we should not provide any workaround and
can just remove the os-hosts logic from Rally.

[*] https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/releasenotes/notes/remove-hosts-d08855550c40b9c6.yaml

Change-Id: I915983dbc634dafcab1cc54dba7bae8d4e368884

commit_message:
Changed MariaDB version to 10.2.13

There was a bug in MariaDB 10.2.12 and lower, that prevent
upgrade DB schema for Openstack Barbican service.

Change-Id: Ib47d1c5060d93f63ac9d4f7d32b25642d801dd15
Closes-Bug: 1734329

commit_message:
Network: Add tag support for QoS policy

This patch adds set tags operation and query parameters
for QoS policy.

Meanwhile overwrite set_tags for QoS policy,
The resource type for QoS policy tagging should be
'policies'.

Change-Id: I7f7025c3c86fbbe3bfae992ed23352e37257ea64
Partial-Bug: #1750987
Closes-Bug: #1751984

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-02 07:54:24.000000000', 'message': "Fix private_v4 selection related to floating ip matching

The change to look for floating ips first when looking for the public
address exposed a latent bug in the private ip finding
code. When we get the mac address of the floating ip, we then look for
the corresponding fixed ip to return for private_v4. However, we weren't
specifying fixed before, so we were just getting the first one that
matched. That *happened* to be the fixed ip by accident.

Add in ext_tag='fixed' so that we look for the matching MAC from a fixed
interface.

We have to also add a second pass through the loop without the fixed
tag, as old nova network dicts do not have the fixed/floating tag like
that.

Includes a test which shows the breakage.

Story: 2001619
Change-Id: I60562a99f78c0c363f49106c285935448f804084
"}, {'created': '2018-03-02 19:20:34.000000000', 'message': "Fix private_v4 selection related to floating ip matching

specifying fixed before, so we were just getting the first one that
matched. That *happened* to be the fixed ip by accident.

Add in ext_tag='fixed' so that we look for the matching MAC from a fixed
interface.

We have to also add a second pass through the loop without the fixed
tag, as old nova network dicts do not have the fixed/floating tag like
that.

Includes a test which shows the breakage.

Story: 2001619
Change-Id: I60562a99f78c0c363f49106c285935448f804084

matched. That *happened* to be the fixed ip by accident.

Add in ext_tag='fixed' so that we look for the matching MAC from a fixed
interface.

We have to also add a second pass through the loop without the fixed
tag, as old nova network dicts do not have the fixed/floating tag like

Includes a test which shows the breakage.

commit_message:
Fix private_v4 selection related to floating ip matching

The change to look for floating ips first when looking for the public
address exposed a latent bug in the private ip finding
code. When we get the mac address of the floating ip, we then look for
the corresponding fixed ip to return for private_v4. However, we weren't
specifying fixed before, so we were just getting the first one that
matched. That *happened* to be the fixed ip by accident.

Add in ext_tag='fixed' so that we look for the matching MAC from a fixed
interface.

We have to also add a second pass through the loop without the fixed
tag, as old nova network dicts do not have the fixed/floating tag like
that.

Includes a test which shows the breakage.

Story: 2001619
Change-Id: I60562a99f78c0c363f49106c285935448f804084

commit_message:
Run etcd and flanneld in a system container

In Fedora Atomic 27 etcd and flanneld are removed from the base image.
Install them as a system containers.

* update docker-storage configuration
* add etcd and flannel tags as labels

Change-Id: I2103c7c3d50f4b68ddc11abff72bc9e3f22839f3
Closes-Bug: #1735381

- gate-nova-specs-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/47/318047/5/check/gate-nova-specs-python27/ea71252/ : SUCCESS in 4m 13s'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2016-06-27 13:22:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Programming or re-programming the FPGA, including image management for the algorithm code, is outside of the scope for Nova. There will be the ability for an admin to define the resources that a programmed FPGA will provide, and to handle the inventory of these resources.'}, {'account_id': 13692, 'date': '2016-06-29 12:38:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Programming or re-programming the FPGA, including image management for 
> the algorithm code, is outside of the scope for Nova.

That's correct. That's why I've mentioned about library/service, which 
will do all of the magic stuff for (re)programming FPGA and provide a 
current status of the device to Nova resource tracker.

> There will be the  ability for an admin to define the resources that a 
> programmed FPGA will  provide, and to handle the inventory of these 
> resources.

Yes. As a first step we decided on summit to have already programmed 
accelerator by admin. This blueprint about that case is what Jay already 
stared in [1], however in this very BP, I'm looking a little ahead.

The next steps would be something, which I'm trying to gather in this 
blueprint, so that we will be possible to:

* manage and schedule resources which will have very dynamic nature
* there should be entire device passed to VM or baremetal (this could be
  done even today using PCI passthrough)
* resource could be created as an accelerator, so that possibility to 
  passthrough entire device should be unavailable at this point for
  this particular device
* to add complexity to this picture - there can be several accelerators on 
  the same FPGA device, so that there also should be taken into account 
* and last, but not least, it may happen, that requested amount of 
  contexts, my only fit in certain region of FPGA (or specific device) so 
  it's also matters during scheduling

IMHO it is especially interesting form ongoing work with changing of 
representation and management of resources in Nova.

Funny fact is, that there is spec from Fei Chen [2] who propose very 
similar design of possible implementation to one that was demonstrated 
during two past summits at Intel booth‚Ä¶

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/312696/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/323130/"}, {'account_id': 22063, 'date': '2016-06-29 13:34:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> Funny fact is, that there is spec from Fei Chen [2] who propose
 > very
 > similar design of possible implementation to one that was
 > demonstrated
 > during two past summits at Intel booth‚Ä¶

Just kindly to let you know, a prototype as you said the implementation is public at 2014 [1] and a public cloud [2] is already publicly running nearly two years. All are based on OpenStack.
[1] http://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=2597929
[2] https://ptopenlab.com'}, {'account_id': 13692, 'date': '2016-06-29 13:47:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Fei, I kindly apologize, if you feel offended. Indeed not the right words to choose, here. What I tried to point out was, that people trying to bring FPGA into the OpenStack, sometimes duplicating (in some extent) the ideas behind the implementation, and what is more important - there is a lot of interest to bring accelerators programmed on FPGA to tenants.'}, {'account_id': 22063, 'date': '2016-06-29 14:13:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Fei, I kindly apologize, if you feel offended. Indeed not the right
 > words to choose, here. What I tried to point out was, that people
 > trying to bring FPGA into the OpenStack, sometimes duplicating (in
 > some extent) the ideas behind the implementation, and what is more
 > important - there is a lot of interest to bring accelerators
 > programmed on FPGA to tenants.

That's fine. I think both we believe magic accelerator service can be provided to tenants on OpenStack when it supports."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2016-09-28 12:28:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 13692, 'date': '2016-10-03 08:08:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

- gate-nova-specs-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/47/318047/6/check/gate-nova-specs-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/b70d823/ : SUCCESS in 1m 57s
- gate-nova-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/47/318047/6/check/gate-nova-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial/6fb5041/ : SUCCESS in 2m 31s'}, {'account_id': 25588, 'date': '2017-06-02 11:19:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

This is a perfectly valid use case! Unfortunately the scope is to narrow.
Please see the following spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/435397/2/specs/pike/approved/virt-device-tagged-attach-detach.rst

If we could tag specific PCI devices (not only using DID and VID but also using physical address) that would cover your use case.'}, {'account_id': 25588, 'date': '2017-11-24 14:14:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2018-02-27 11:42:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

There is now a Cyborg project trying to provide FGPA devices... Should we abandon that spec ?
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Cyborg'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-02-27 11:43:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

Agree that this has been superseded by the Cyborg effort.'}, {'account_id': 13692, 'date': '2018-03-04 15:48:41.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Agree. This was just a brain-dump for possibility to have something complicated as FPGA as a resource in Nova.'}]

commit_message:
FPGA resource use cases

This is a proposal how FPGA (Field-programmable gate array) type of
accelerators might be managed within OpenStack. There are couple of use
cases, which should be considered, for modelling the FPGA/region/contex
resources.

Change-Id: I835dd8bc5dd56635e86f23d53f60e83d7c70fffe

commit_message:
Adding the #edge-computing-group channel to accessbot

A new channel was created for broader discussions around edge computing
and related topics. This patch adds the channel under accessbot.

Change-Id: I1e6f4f7fc6342577829f4c1a08ea539cee2376c3

commit_message:
ensure easy_install and pip are installed

Ensure easy_install and pip are installed as
this can be an issue on RHEL and other platforms.

Change-Id: Id8269e8f9dbe47f316a87e1e479f39f941f246e0

Depends-On: Ic58e53365dc1d80c6274ee976b8c59892781d9a4

'}]
commit_message:
Move settings to tripleo-quickstart to be included in common vars

This move modifies the OVB settings to fit the feature set pattern.
multi-nics and public-bond will be included in feature sets.

Depends-On: Ic58e53365dc1d80c6274ee976b8c59892781d9a4
Change-Id: Ie7339b2f0e50f834a1bf8c3d5f520b35c708bc39

commit_message:
Create default settings for environment types

Some settings are default across envrionments, but
are still considered envrionment settings as they are
not configuration or topology. Include these variables
by default based on environment_type.

Change-Id: Ic58e53365dc1d80c6274ee976b8c59892781d9a4

commit_message:
Change windmill jobs from fedora-26 to fedora-27

We are working to remove fedora-26 nodes from nodepool.

Change-Id: Ic7e094a3f511b4b1961bbfed065a3df960f7ea10
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix the incorrect reference links

TrivialFix
[1] is the installation guide for OpenStack components, and [2]
is the installation guide for manila, obviously, we need [1] in
the docs.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/latest/install/
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/manila/latest/install/index.html

Change-Id: I53dc68b1ca13c18423e0c1c5d381faa72982e20b

The TripleO CI team requires a live unmerged change
to test delorean builds.  DO NOT MERGE

[{'created': '2018-03-03 14:38:07.000000000', 'message': 'Add os-client-config tips jobs

Make a job that tests os-client-config against tips of openstacksdk and
keystoneauth. This way we can also add it to openstacksdk as we work on
turning occ into a thin shim.

Change-Id: Ie5a6b780f87eb9d10eaf5b99770c43ab140780ae
'}]
commit_message:
Add os-client-config tips jobs

Make a job that tests os-client-config against tips of openstacksdk and
keystoneauth. This way we can also add it to openstacksdk as we work on
turning occ into a thin shim.

Change-Id: Ie5a6b780f87eb9d10eaf5b99770c43ab140780ae

From https://logs.rdoproject.org/95/546995/2/openstack-check/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-3ctlr_1comp-featureset001-ocata/Z16c4f74d64ba40c9962eca645915e9fa/overcloud-controller-0/etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg.gz horizon stanza looks fine:
listen horizon                                                                                                                                                                                
  bind 10.0.0.5:443 transparent ssl crt /etc/pki/tls/private/overcloud_endpoint.pem
  bind 10.0.0.5:80 transparent
  bind 172.17.0.16:443 transparent ssl crt /etc/pki/tls/private/overcloud_endpoint.pem
  bind 172.17.0.16:80 transparent
  mode http
  cookie SERVERID insert indirect nocache
  http-request set-header X-Forwarded-Proto https if { ssl_fc }
  http-request set-header X-Forwarded-Proto http if !{ ssl_fc }
  option forwardfor
  redirect scheme https code 301 if !{ ssl_fc }
  rsprep ^Location:\ http://(.*) Location:\ https://\1
  server overcloud-controller-2.internalapi.localdomain 172.17.0.11:80 check cookie overcloud-controller-2.internalapi.localdomain fall 5 inter 2000 rise 2
  server overcloud-controller-0.internalapi.localdomain 172.17.0.13:80 check cookie overcloud-controller-0.internalapi.localdomain fall 5 inter 2000 rise 2
  server overcloud-controller-1.internalapi.localdomain 172.17.0.19:80 check cookie overcloud-controller-1.internalapi.localdomain fall 5 inter 2000 rise 2'}, {'account_id': 6449, 'date': '2018-02-26 10:06:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2018-02-26 10:11:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-03-01 09:46:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-03-04 11:44:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-22 14:15:30.000000000', 'message': "WIP Give horizon's stanza in haproxy a per-server cookie

Currently our haproxy.cfg stanza for horizon looks like the following:
server overcloud-controller-0.internalapi.localdomain 172.17.0.22:80 check cookie overcloud-controller-0 fall 5 inter 2000 rise 2
server overcloud-controller-1.internalapi.localdomain 172.17.0.25:80 check cookie overcloud-controller-0 fall 5 inter 2000 rise 2
server overcloud-controller-2.internalapi.localdomain 172.17.0.12:80 check cookie overcloud-controller-0 fall 5 inter 2000 rise 2

We need to make sure that the cookie is set the same as the server:
server overcloud-controller-0.internalapi.localdomain 172.17.0.22:80 check cookie overcloud-controller-0.internalapi.localdomain fall 5 inter 2000 rise 2
server overcloud-controller-1.internalapi.localdomain 172.17.0.25:80 check cookie overcloud-controller-1.internalapi.localdomain fall 5 inter 2000 rise 2
server overcloud-controller-2.internalapi.localdomain 172.17.0.12:80 check cookie overcloud-controller-2.internalapi.localdomain fall 5 inter 2000 rise 2

The problem here is that the cookie is being inserted into the response
by haproxy so that we have session persistence. When logging to horizon
we want the session to be persistent and go to the same backend server.
When haproxy sees a match for the cookie, it does just that. The cookie
value will should match the server name. Prior to this fix
each server was matching on the same cookie ($::hostname) which is not
correct.

Tested by connecting to horizon's VIP and shutting off horizon on each
controller node one at the time. Observed that after each stop, the
correct cookie from the remaining servers was sent to the browser.

WIP because it was not an easy cherry-pick due to missing change
I1a68771cc7be7fb2b32abbad81db7890bd2c5502 in ocata, so I'd like to test
it first.

Closes-Bug: #1738453
Change-Id: Ieb9cf3c6a8373df288a73ff2dacfc9d0b09e675a
"}, {'created': '2018-02-22 16:51:20.000000000', 'message': "Give horizon's stanza in haproxy a per-server cookie
