commit_message:
Stop showing results with passwords

It seems that when images are pulled that the whole
kolla_docker result includes the auth password and auth
user name and such; which in our system gets captured
by ara due to the fact that no_log is not marked (which
should stop ara from capturing the results).

Change-Id: I490df78df50a977d448d8bc2fb305b3687b391d4

subject: Stop showing nova passwords during bootstrap
messages:
[{'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-02-16 17:53:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2018-02-16 18:33:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2018-02-17 06:52:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

IMHO, 
1. this commit is not stop show the password(auth) info, but all output, it is not a good idea. when the task failed, you can not get the log, just like 
failed: [localhost] (item=None) => {"censored": "the output has been hidden due to the fact that 'no_log: true' was specified for this result"}

2. operator will rum aciton on deploy node, he will configure the auth password, name and so on, he can get everything if he want,  No Display make no sense for him,
3. why the other projects(like cinder) not need do this change?

if I'm wrong, please tell me, I will remove my -1'}, {'account_id': 11869, 'date': '2018-02-19 05:58:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

agree caoyuan,'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-02-20 08:24:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

In my opinion, this should be fixed in the ansible module, i dont like hide all the output because make things impossible to debug.

mysql_db module probably already set no_log to login_password, but in our implementation (module who calls a module) dont.

We have to find a way to add no_log to passwords in called modules.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-02-21 01:04:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

What does the following mean 'mysql_db module probably already set no_log to login_password'?"}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-02-21 01:16:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-21 09:09:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-02-22 04:44:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-02-22 04:52:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

How does one proxy that through to the underlying module though? 

Kolla_toolbox is really like a meta-module so I'm not sure how you would proxy them through to that low of a level (ie, the kolla_toolbox isn't really generating new ansible modules on demand with various parameters, it's just shifting a bunch of module_args from yaml into a ansible command and the running that ansible command inside a docker container); unless there is a way to actually have kolla_toolbox generate real modules that map much closer to the actual module it would seem hard to do...

For example:

https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/library/kolla_toolbox.py#L116-L121

The `module_args` and such there are really black box(es) in that they can be just any dictionary, perhaps it's better to start to figure out how to create a better kolla_toolbox module that actually proxies and hides things just like the module it is calling into or do something else (maybe upstream ansible folks have some ideas...); or perhaps we should not have a single 'kolla_toolbox' module but actually create per-usage modules instead (where we can actually define the arguments in a clear manner and correctly proxy them through with the right `no_log` arguments....)

I'm open to ideas, but the fact that kolla_toolbox is a somewhat 'blind proxy' is not helping :-P"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-22 10:04:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> How does one proxy that through to the underlying module though?
 > 
 > Kolla_toolbox is really like a meta-module so I'm not sure how you
 > would proxy them through to that low of a level (ie, the
 > kolla_toolbox isn't really generating new ansible modules on demand
 > with various parameters, it's just shifting a bunch of module_args
 > from yaml into a ansible command and the running that ansible
 > command inside a docker container); unless there is a way to
 > actually have kolla_toolbox generate real modules that map much
 > closer to the actual module it would seem hard to do...
 > 
 > For example:
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/library/kolla_toolbox.py#L116-L121
 > 
 > The `module_args` and such there are really black box(es) in that
 > they can be just any dictionary, perhaps it's better to start to
 > figure out how to create a better kolla_toolbox module that
 > actually proxies and hides things just like the module it is
 > calling into or do something else (maybe upstream ansible folks
 > have some ideas...); or perhaps we should not have a single
 > 'kolla_toolbox' module but actually create per-usage modules
 > instead (where we can actually define the arguments in a clear
 > manner and correctly proxy them through with the right `no_log`
 > arguments....)
 > 
 > I'm open to ideas, but the fact that kolla_toolbox is a somewhat
 > 'blind proxy' is not helping :-P

We don't need to proxy no_log through to the real module - we just expect the module's argument to already have no_log applied - as it is for mysql_db. In cases where the underlying module argument does not have no_log applied (e.g. command), we'd need to do something else."}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-02-28 20:55:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok, let's see how that goes; I'm not totally convinced it will be enough but let's see."}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-03-02 21:32:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Moving this to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/546467/'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-03-02 21:33:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 17:53:16.000000000', 'message': "Stop showing nova passwords during bootstrap

We are seeing nova passwords in our logs (and in ara
which is used to watch and capture what we are doing
and how the build is progressing) and that is not a
good thing to be having happen; so turn on no_log

Change-Id: I6c5af651646acd916eb0c3e8a2decd16fef061b4
"}]
commit_message:
Stop showing nova passwords during bootstrap

We are seeing nova passwords in our logs (and in ara
which is used to watch and capture what we are doing
and how the build is progressing) and that is not a
good thing to be having happen; so turn on no_log
so that in theory we shouldn't be seeing these anymore.

Bug: #1748528
Change-Id: I6c5af651646acd916eb0c3e8a2decd16fef061b4

commit_message:
Adding new config parameters for Cisco UCSM ML2 driver

UCSM ML2 driver now supports the following additional
configuration parameters:
1. ucsm_https_verify
2. sp_template_list
3. vnic_template_list

Change-Id: Ie74f1b9653894f8c717156beb604dae9d9e60e6a
(cherry picked from commit b2d76220f09b5ea2b67af91f43d0a26e4f26dce9)

commit_message:
Adding new config parameters for Cisco UCSM ML2 driver

UCSM ML2 driver now supports the following additional
configuration parameters:
1. ucsm_https_verify
2. sp_template_list
3. vnic_template_list

Conflicts:
        puppet/extraconfig/all_nodes/neutron-ml2-cisco-nexus-ucsm.j2.yaml

Change-Id: Ie74f1b9653894f8c717156beb604dae9d9e60e6a
 (cherry picked from commit b2d76220f09b5ea2b67af91f43d0a26e4f26dce9)

commit_message:
Fix private_v4 selection related to floating ip matching

The change to look for floating ips first when looking for the public
address exposed a latent bug in the private ip finding
code. When we get the mac address of the floating ip, we then look for
the corresponding fixed ip to return for private_v4. However, we weren't
specifying fixed before, so we were just getting the first one that
matched. That *happened* to be the fixed ip by accident.

Add in ext_tag='fixed' so that we look for the matching MAC from a fixed
interface.

We have to also add a second pass through the loop without the fixed
tag, as old nova network dicts do not have the fixed/floating tag like
that.

Includes a test which shows the breakage.

Story: 2001619
Change-Id: I60562a99f78c0c363f49106c285935448f804084

commit_message:
Fix the testcase of test_cmd

Any configured value of cluster would lead to
the failure of test_cmd testcases, fix this by
override the option with None value.

subject: Fix private_v4 selection related to floating ip matching
messages: [{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-03-02 07:40:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-03-02 07:52:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-03-02 07:53:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-03-02 19:22:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-02 07:40:12.000000000', 'message': "Fix private_v4 selection related to floating ip matching

The change to look for floating ips first when looking for the public
address exposed a latent bug in the private ip finding
code. When we get the mac address of the floating ip, we then look for
the corresponding fixed ip to return for private_v4. However, we weren't
specifying fixed before, so we were just getting the first one that
matched. That *happened* to be the fixed ip by accident.

Add in ext_tag='fixed' so that we look for the matching MAC from a fixed
interface.

Includes a test which shows the breakage.

Story: 2001619
Change-Id: I60562a99f78c0c363f49106c285935448f804084
"}, {'created': '2018-03-02 07:52:10.000000000', 'message': "Fix private_v4 selection related to floating ip matching

The change to look for floating ips first when looking for the public
address exposed a latent bug in the private ip finding
code. When we get the mac address of the floating ip, we then look for
the corresponding fixed ip to return for private_v4. However, we weren't
specifying fixed before, so we were just getting the first one that
matched. That *happened* to be the fixed ip by accident.

Add in ext_tag='fixed' so that we look for the matching MAC from a fixed
interface.

We have to also add a second pass through the loop without the fixed
tag, as old nova network dicts do not have the fixed/floating tag like
that.

Includes a test which shows the breakage.

Story: 2001619
Change-Id: I60562a99f78c0c363f49106c285935448f804084
"}]
commit_message:
Fix private_v4 selection related to floating ip matching

The change to look for floating ips first when looking for the public
address exposed a latent bug in the private ip finding
code. When we get the mac address of the floating ip, we then look for
the corresponding fixed ip to return for private_v4. However, we weren't
specifying fixed before, so we were just getting the first one that
matched. That *happened* to be the fixed ip by accident.

Add in ext_tag='fixed' so that we look for the matching MAC from a fixed
interface.

We have to also add a second pass through the loop without the fixed
tag, as old nova network dicts do not have the fixed/floating tag like
that.

Includes a test which shows the breakage.

Story: 2001619
Change-Id: I60562a99f78c0c363f49106c285935448f804084

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-25 15:59:13.000000000', 'message': 'Rename Zuul jobs

We have a global namespace in OpenStack CI for *all* jobs accross repos,
therefore jobs in-tree should started with the repo name.

Rename the jobs according to our conventions: Use manila as first
component, remove dsvm from renamed jobs. I left dsvm in the jobs that
are used in other repos, those can be renamed later.

For details, see
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#consistent-naming-for-jobs-with-zuul-v3

Change-Id: Iefe8452e81131ce775668d08e1c9720194477ff3
'}]
commit_message:
Rename Zuul jobs

We have a global namespace in OpenStack CI for *all* jobs accross repos,
therefore jobs in-tree should started with the repo name.

Rename the jobs according to our conventions: Use manila as first
component, remove dsvm from renamed jobs. I left dsvm in the jobs that
are used in other repos, those can be renamed later.

For details, see
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#consistent-naming-for-jobs-with-zuul-v3

Change-Id: Iefe8452e81131ce775668d08e1c9720194477ff3

subject: Fix object-server to not 400 all expirer DELETEs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 4608, 'name': 'Kota Tsuyuzaki', 'email': 'kota.tsuyuzaki.pc@hco.ntt.co.jp', 'username': 'tsuyuzaki-kota'}, {'_account_id': 9625, 'name': 'Thiago da Silva', 'email': 'thiagodasilva@gmail.com', 'username': 'thiago'}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-03-01 14:44:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2018-03-01 15:49:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

I like this change! Thanks Tim to take care of this.

The reason just +1 because I couldn't test this locally because of network problem (gerrit got timeout) in PTG hotel with a lot of people is working here at the same time. I'll turn it to +2 when i would get able to download and run this patch successfully."}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2018-03-01 17:10:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-03-01 17:13:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2018-03-01 18:55:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-03-02 10:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

I went back and looked at Ibf61eb1f767a48cb457dd494e1f7c12acfd205de - the unittests for obj.expirer and obj.server BOTH use already used normalized timestamp strings already - so we were primed to make exactly this mistake - and using the Timestamp utils module is exactly the right way to avoid these silly normalization issues in the future.

Maybe the smell for next time is "yeah, this service isn't doing proper normalization in it's api requests!?  we should TOTALLY fix that!?  Hrmm... I wonder if the OTHER side of this API is doing proper normalization..."'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-03-02 13:11:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-03-02 15:26:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-03-02 15:27:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1

Rebased on top of the docs-build fix. Approving based on previous +2s.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-01 14:44:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix object-server to not 400 all expirer DELETEs

In the related changes, we switched to using
Timestamp.normal representations for the X-If-Delete-At header.
However, the object-server required that the header be an int,
and the trailing '.00000' would cause trip the
"Bad X-If-Delete-At header value" error handling.

Now, we'll convert both the expirer header and the stored X-Delete-At to
Timestamps, even though we expect them to have no fractional value.

Note that we *could* have changed the expirer to continue sending
headers that are valid ints, but Timestamps are already the normal
Swift-way of passing and comparing times -- we should use that.

Related-Change: Ibf61eb1f767a48cb457dd494e1f7c12acfd205de
Related-Change: Ie82622625d13177e08a363686ec632f63d24f4e9
Change-Id: Ida22c1c8c5bf21bdc72c33e225e75fb750f8444b
'}, {'created': '2018-03-02 15:26:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix object-server to not 400 all expirer DELETEs

In the related changes, we switched to using
Timestamp.normal representations for the X-If-Delete-At header.
However, the object-server required that the header be an int,
and the trailing '.00000' would cause trip the
"Bad X-If-Delete-At header value" error handling.

Now, we'll convert both the expirer header and the stored X-Delete-At to
Timestamps, even though we expect them to have no fractional value.

Note that we *could* have changed the expirer to continue sending
headers that are valid ints, but Timestamps are already the normal
Swift-way of passing and comparing times -- we should use that.

Related-Change: Ibf61eb1f767a48cb457dd494e1f7c12acfd205de
Related-Change: Ie82622625d13177e08a363686ec632f63d24f4e9

commit_message:
Fix object-server to not 400 all expirer DELETEs

In the related changes, we switched to using
Timestamp.normal representations for the X-If-Delete-At header.
However, the object-server required that the header be an int,
and the trailing '.00000' would cause trip the
"Bad X-If-Delete-At header value" error handling.

Now, we'll convert both the expirer header and the stored X-Delete-At to
Timestamps, even though we expect them to have no fractional value.

Note that we *could* have changed the expirer to continue sending
headers that are valid ints, but Timestamps are already the normal
Swift-way of passing and comparing times -- we should use that.

Related-Change: Ibf61eb1f767a48cb457dd494e1f7c12acfd205de
Related-Change: Ie82622625d13177e08a363686ec632f63d24f4e9
Change-Id: Ida22c1c8c5bf21bdc72c33e225e75fb750f8444b

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-07 12:04:46.000000000', 'message': "[placement] re-use existing conf with auth token middleware

If 'oslo_config_project' is passed to the auth_token filter
factory, the mechanism in nova.api.openstack.placement.wsgi for
overriding the location of the configuration file is ignored
meaning that expected custom configuration is also ignored.

Instead pass the already existing conf with 'olso_config_config'
parameter.

The unit test in test_deploy.py shows that the configuration
settings get passed to the middleware and used by testing the
value of the 'WWW-Authenticate' header (which comes from a few
different configuration settings, of which is 'auth_uri') in
a response generated by the placement WSGI application.
The same test against the previous deploy.py code fails.

Change-Id: I61d20c5d19797f7e66648c7864a632f3328be8ce
Closes-Bug: #1734491
(cherry picked from commit b2e02f5147d79eaf4fd935507590fec5a0ba7ccf)
"}]
commit_message:
[placement] re-use existing conf with auth token middleware

If 'oslo_config_project' is passed to the auth_token filter
factory, the mechanism in nova.api.openstack.placement.wsgi for
overriding the location of the configuration file is ignored
meaning that expected custom configuration is also ignored.

Instead pass the already existing conf with 'olso_config_config'
parameter.

The unit test in test_deploy.py shows that the configuration
settings get passed to the middleware and used by testing the
value of the 'WWW-Authenticate' header (which comes from a few
different configuration settings, of which is 'auth_uri') in
a response generated by the placement WSGI application.
The same test against the previous deploy.py code fails.

Change-Id: I61d20c5d19797f7e66648c7864a632f3328be8ce
Closes-Bug: #1734491
(cherry picked from commit b2e02f5147d79eaf4fd935507590fec5a0ba7ccf)

commit_message:
Modify tests to account for ScaleIO creating volumes = 8GB

Some backends cannot create volumes in sizes of 1GB,
such as ScaleIO. In that case, ensure volumes are created and
extended in multiples of what they can support.

subject: Allow ingress to override public domain wildcard
messages:
[{'account_id': 27892, 'date': '2018-02-28 17:37:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-02-28 17:37:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 27892, 'date': '2018-02-28 17:53:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27892, 'date': '2018-02-28 17:54:55.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from cmm1 to ingress'}, {'account_id': 27892, 'date': '2018-02-28 18:48:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2018-03-01 10:00:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27892, 'date': '2018-03-02 14:40:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27892, 'date': '2018-03-02 14:43:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-03-02 18:19:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Hey, this is a really nice feature to have, and we really need to support it. But it will require a lot more than just changing the public wildcard for the cluster ingress - would it be possible to create a blueprint and we can iterate from there?'}, {'account_id': 27892, 'date': '2018-03-02 18:23:21.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Make a blueprint'}, {'account_id': 27892, 'date': '2018-03-02 18:38:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(3 comments)

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-helm/+spec/public-domain-wildcard'}]
commit_message:
Allow ingress to override public domain wildcard

This is instead of being constrained to using
*.{{ namespace }}.svc.{{ cluster_name }}

Change-Id: I522c8f4038cb7389ba085b0758b3af746e4c4991

commit_message:
Switch feature keyword required back to mandatory

As per reviews in Nova, they originally started this sphinx plugin, so
we'll keep mandatory as a keyword on whether a feature is required or
not. Also we'll switch incomplete back to missing.

Change-Id: I30db17ac06b3ebc76b79967721b7f0929ecac689

subject: Generate resource UIDs in same format as libcalico-go
messages: [{'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-03-01 13:57:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-03-01 14:21:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-03-01 23:44:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-03-02 00:46:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 19461, 'date': '2018-03-02 10:16:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-03-02 15:35:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-03-02 15:36:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-01 13:57:39.000000000', 'message': "Generate UIDs in same format as libcalico-go

i.e. like '986c5a02-2478-414b-bef5-611ea7a66a60', whereas the code
before this change would generate '986c5a022478414bbef5611ea7a66a60',
without the hyphens.

Change-Id: I9ee4c44ac1a838ae3850dc842b83ce7389fcb829
"}, {'created': '2018-03-01 14:21:15.000000000', 'message': "Generate resource UIDs in same format as libcalico-go

i.e. like '986c5a02-2478-414b-bef5-611ea7a66a60', whereas the code
before this change would generate '986c5a022478414bbef5611ea7a66a60',
without the hyphens.

Note: networking-calico still uses 'get_hex()' - which gives the
'986c5a022478414bbef5611ea7a66a60' format - when generating a value for
the ClusterGUID field.  libcalico-go also generates that format for
ClusterGUID.

So in summary,
- networking-calico and libcalico-go are now consistent with each other,
  in that they generate similar formats for a given situation
- networking-calico and libcalico-go are both (and equally) inconsistent
  with themselves, in that they generate different formats for
  ClusterGUID and resource UIDs.

Change-Id: I9ee4c44ac1a838ae3850dc842b83ce7389fcb829

without the hyphens.

Note: networking-calico still uses 'get_hex()' - which gives the
'986c5a022478414bbef5611ea7a66a60' format - when generating a value for
the ClusterGUID field.  libcalico-go also generates that format for

commit_message:
Generate resource UIDs in same format as libcalico-go

i.e. like '986c5a02-2478-414b-bef5-611ea7a66a60', whereas the code
before this change would generate '986c5a022478414bbef5611ea7a66a60',
without the hyphens.

Note: networking-calico still uses 'get_hex()' - which gives the
'986c5a022478414bbef5611ea7a66a60' format - when generating a value for
the ClusterGUID field.  libcalico-go also generates that format for
ClusterGUID.

So in summary,
- networking-calico and libcalico-go are now consistent with each other,
  in that they generate similar formats for a given situation
- networking-calico and libcalico-go are both (and equally) inconsistent
  with themselves, in that they generate different formats for
  ClusterGUID and resource UIDs.

Change-Id: I9ee4c44ac1a838ae3850dc842b83ce7389fcb829

commit_message:
zuul: Add missing CentOS and openSUSE jobs

openSUSE and CentOS have been voting jobs for a while so we should
start testing all the scenarios on them. The only job that hasn't
been added is the ZFS one since there is no such package on openSUSE
or CentOS.

Change-Id: Icde5ed7a4e6be8ac19412f15b84febf2096ba404

Add ansible as a dependency

The main script quickstar.sh depends on the command ansible-playbook, this command is installed
with the ansible package, and this package is not in the dependencies list.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-02 15:41:29.000000000', 'message': 'tests: Use ansible_pkg_mgr fact to determine the BTRFS package

The ansible_distribution variable is causing some troubles since it can
contain spaces etc. As such, we can simply use the ansible_pkg_mgr
module to figure out the name of the package we want to install.

Change-Id: Ic92eb1f9030df2883b049b9868e031ff4f0d42f2
'}]
commit_message:
tests: Use ansible_pkg_mgr fact to determine the BTRFS package

The ansible_distribution variable is causing some troubles since it can
contain spaces etc. As such, we can simply use the ansible_pkg_mgr
module to figure out the name of the package we want to install.

Change-Id: Ic92eb1f9030df2883b049b9868e031ff4f0d42f2

commit_message:
Updated NetApp driver features support mapping

NetApp ONTAP driver supports IPv6 since Queens. This patch updates
the features support mapping tables with this support.

TrivialFix

commit_message:
Remove compute nodes arg from ProviderTree init

The cns (list of compute nodes) argument to ProviderTree.__init__ was
not being used except in unit test, so this change removes it.  At this
stage of ProviderTree's maturity, it seems unlikely that it will ever be
needed (if it is, we can add it back).

Change-Id: I05022b79001b606e448b4af593af7f43c239ada9

subject: Fixes needed to networking-calico etcdv3 usage
messages: [{'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-02-28 18:02:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-02-28 18:06:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-03-01 23:42:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 19461, 'date': '2018-03-02 10:14:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19461, 'date': '2018-03-02 10:14:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 19461, 'date': '2018-03-02 14:49:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-03-02 15:32:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-03-02 15:34:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-28 18:02:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes needed to networking-calico etcdv3 usage

This commit contains 4 fixes that are all related to
networking-calico's etcdv3 usage, and that have been revealed through CI
testing.  They are in detail unrelated, but I think it makes sense to
commit them together, as they are all needed ASAP as fixups to
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544586/.

1. Make DHCP agent handle etcd being initially unavailable

Specifically this is to handle errors like this, when etcd is not yet
available when the DHCP agent starts:

2018-02-27 23:43:35,846 [39149232] (CRITICAL) log: Unhandled error
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron Traceback (most recent call last):
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron   File "/usr/bin/calico-dhcp-agent", line 10, in <module>
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron     sys.exit(main())
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/networking_calico/agent/dhcp_agent.py", line 611, in main
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron     agent.run()
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/osprofiler/profiler.py", line 153, in wrapper
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron     return f(*args, **kwargs)
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/networking_calico/agent/dhcp_agent.py", line 577, in run
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron     self.etcd.start()
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/networking_calico/agent/dhcp_agent.py", line 167, in start
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron     super(CalicoEtcdWatcher, self).start()
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/networking_calico/etcdutils.py", line 133, in start
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron     cluster_id, last_revision = etcdv3.get_status()
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/networking_calico/etcdv3.py", line 268, in get_status
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron     status = client.status()
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/etcd3gw/client.py", line 97, in status
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron     json={})
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/etcd3gw/client.py", line 88, in post
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron     raise exceptions.ConnectionFailedError(six.text_type(ex))
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron ConnectionFailedError: HTTPConnectionPool(host='192.168.8.2', port=2379): Max retries exceeded with url: /v3alpha/maintenance/status (Caused by NewConnectionError('<requests.packages.urllib3.connection.HTTPConnection object at 0x64d1c90>: Failed to establish a new connection: [Errno 111] ECONNREFUSED',))

2. Rewrite election key so non-masters see progress

The problem here was non-masters watching for events on the election key
and seeing nothing for an interval of twice the expected TTL.  With
etcdv2 the master would refresh by rewriting the key, which meant that
non-masters saw an event.  With etcdv3 the idiom is not to rewrite the
key but instead just refresh the related lease object - but the
semantics of that is (intentionally) that the watchers don't see any
event when the lease is refreshed.  We need the non-master watchers to
see an event, so rewrite the key as well as refreshing the lease.

3. Return None value(s) for corrupt v3 data

We have a test that corrupts the etcd data for a WorkloadEndpoint and
expects networking-calico to fix it again when it resyncs from the
Neutron DB.  This test was failing because the resync was failing to
rewrite the correct data, because of incorrectly expecting that they
would be no existing value at that time.

4. Avoid ERROR logs when election key is deleted

We have a test that deletes the master election key in order to force a
new election.  The code to handle this was working fine but dropping
some ERROR logs that ought to have been avoided.

Change-Id: I9313bf2b3de2d6bb7cf1e60e78adcb161474fb66

commit_message:
Fixes needed to networking-calico etcdv3 usage

This commit contains 4 fixes that are all related to
networking-calico's etcdv3 usage, and that have been revealed through CI
testing.  They are in detail unrelated, but I think it makes sense to
commit them together, as they are all needed ASAP as fixups to
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544586/.

1. Make DHCP agent handle etcd being initially unavailable

Specifically this is to handle errors like this, when etcd is not yet
available when the DHCP agent starts:

2018-02-27 23:43:35,846 [39149232] (CRITICAL) log: Unhandled error
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron Traceback (most recent call last):
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron   File "/usr/bin/calico-dhcp-agent", line 10, in <module>
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron     sys.exit(main())
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/networking_calico/agent/dhcp_agent.py", line 611, in main
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron     agent.run()
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/osprofiler/profiler.py", line 153, in wrapper
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron     return f(*args, **kwargs)
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/networking_calico/agent/dhcp_agent.py", line 577, in run
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron     self.etcd.start()
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/networking_calico/agent/dhcp_agent.py", line 167, in start
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron     super(CalicoEtcdWatcher, self).start()
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/networking_calico/etcdutils.py", line 133, in start
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron     cluster_id, last_revision = etcdv3.get_status()
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/networking_calico/etcdv3.py", line 268, in get_status
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron     status = client.status()
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/etcd3gw/client.py", line 97, in status
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron     json={})
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/etcd3gw/client.py", line 88, in post
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron     raise exceptions.ConnectionFailedError(six.text_type(ex))
2018-02-27 23:43:35.846 18623 ERROR neutron ConnectionFailedError: HTTPConnectionPool(host='192.168.8.2', port=2379): Max retries exceeded with url: /v3alpha/maintenance/status (Caused by NewConnectionError('<requests.packages.urllib3.connection.HTTPConnection object at 0x64d1c90>: Failed to establish a new connection: [Errno 111] ECONNREFUSED',))

2. Rewrite election key so non-masters see progress

The problem here was non-masters watching for events on the election key
and seeing nothing for an interval of twice the expected TTL.  With
etcdv2 the master would refresh by rewriting the key, which meant that
non-masters saw an event.  With etcdv3 the idiom is not to rewrite the
key but instead just refresh the related lease object - but the
semantics of that is (intentionally) that the watchers don't see any
event when the lease is refreshed.  We need the non-master watchers to
see an event, so rewrite the key as well as refreshing the lease.

3. Return None value(s) for corrupt v3 data

We have a test that corrupts the etcd data for a WorkloadEndpoint and
expects networking-calico to fix it again when it resyncs from the
Neutron DB.  This test was failing because the resync was failing to
rewrite the correct data, because of incorrectly expecting that there
would be no existing value at that time.

4. Avoid ERROR logs when election key is deleted

We have a test that deletes the master election key in order to force a
new election.  The code to handle this was working fine but dropping
some ERROR logs that ought to have been avoided.

Change-Id: I9313bf2b3de2d6bb7cf1e60e78adcb161474fb66

commit_message:
use common agent topics from neutron-lib

The neutron.common.topics module was rehomed into neutron-lib with
commit Ie88b84949cbd55a4e7ad06341aab77b286cdc485
This patch consumes it by using neutron-lib's version of the module in
prep for Ia4a4604c259ce862597de80c6deeb3d408bf0e95

Change-Id: Ifcac7a08dab1d23ad992663c03bf9c1d95dc9e8e

In the meanwhile I will focus on getting the openstack-ansible-deploy-ceph-ubuntu-xenial check to pass.'}, {'account_id': 24132, 'date': '2018-02-07 08:17:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 24132, 'date': '2018-02-07 13:19:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 24132, 'date': '2018-02-07 15:37:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 24132, 'date': '2018-02-07 17:43:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 22.'}, {'account_id': 24132, 'date': '2018-02-08 08:02:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 23.'}, {'account_id': 24132, 'date': '2018-02-08 10:16:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23:

recheck - All loogs great to me! - rechecking because the ceph gate is failing and I'd expect that to be passing given the changes."}, {'account_id': 24132, 'date': '2018-02-12 07:35:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 30.'}, {'account_id': 24132, 'date': '2018-02-13 09:45:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30: Code-Review-1

recheck tempest gets an HTTP 416 (Invalid range) when uploading a test object of 1024 bytes.'}, {'account_id': 24132, 'date': '2018-02-19 14:50:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 31.'}, {'account_id': 24132, 'date': '2018-02-19 19:54:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 24132, 'date': '2018-02-20 07:32:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 32.'}, {'account_id': 24132, 'date': '2018-02-20 10:02:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32:

Tempest checks are now passing. It was caused by the "pool_default_pg_num: 32 " triggering the "too many PGs per OSD" warning which blocked the creation of the default.rgw.buckets.data pool which ultimately made rgw not usable in AIO.

I changed "pool_default_pg_num" to 16 to solve this problem.

Additionally I verified that "openstack create container" and "openstack create object" are working and the data shows up in rados in a local AIO setup (ceph scenario).'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-21 09:30:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-21 09:33:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 33: Published edit on patch set 32.'}, {'account_id': 24132, 'date': '2018-02-22 08:10:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 33:

commit_message:
Ceph RadosGW integration

This adds a new scenario for Ceph Rados GW integration:
- It adds the RGW into haproxy to the default swift port if
swift port isn't deployed already
- It adds tempest swift API testing on the rados gw in the
check scenario
- It adds ceph rgw in default inventories.

Change-Id: I5f6ff3fa05a4a8019bf5b695b02184d9f065bc2e
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
Co-Authored-By: Maxime Guyot <maxime.guyot@elits.com>

commit_message:
Add .sh to the original file to collect them.

In upstream log job collection all .sh get collected.  This add
support for this.

Change-Id: I9522e252287b28de741e4da1c31675b233d3cc5d

commit_message:
Add support for using custom FFU repository scripts

This change adds support for passing custom repository scripts
for the FFU repositories setup. This makes use of the
custom-script option enabled by this change:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539503/

Change-Id: I70f348409ddb7773dd68a1022c6f3697bb82b64c

commit_message:
Implement support for FFU undercloud upgrade workarounds

Currently in tripleo-upgrade we only support implementing workarounds
before and after the entire undercloud upgrade process(before upgrading
to ocata and after upgrading to queens). This change allows applying
workarounds pre and post each undercloud upgrade intermediary step.

Change-Id: I78ea4496e600084df61d845949d5cbd6a1a9ba89

[{'created': '2018-03-01 11:03:47.000000000', 'message': "Use tenacity for image upload retries

This change replaces the custom image pull/push retry loop with a
tenacity annotation.

The docker client uses requests, so this fixes an issue where requests
can raise a vendored urllib3 exception if the registry doesn't respond
at all. This will now be caught by tenacity and treated as a retry
condition.

Change-Id: Ifa08f21ccbc1bf04732462d28449546cf146c53a
Closes-Bug: #1749663
"}]
commit_message:
Use tenacity for image upload retries

This change replaces the custom image pull/push retry loop with a
tenacity annotation.

The docker client uses requests, so this fixes an issue where requests
can raise a vendored urllib3 exception if the registry doesn't respond
at all. This will now be caught by tenacity and treated as a retry
condition.

Change-Id: Ifa08f21ccbc1bf04732462d28449546cf146c53a
Closes-Bug: #1749663

commit_message:
OSC command for magnum quota's

Implemented Openstack command for quotas-create, quotas-update,
quotas-delete, quotas-show and quotas-list.

Partially-Implements: blueprint deprecate-magnum-client
(cherry picked from commit e6856282a30d3fff678d8e2592c825ad33314730)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-22 12:45:16.000000000', 'message': "Fix creation of port when network has admin's QoS policy set

In case when admin user creats QoS policy and will attach it to
user's namespace there was an issue with getting such QoS policy
with user's context to validate it.

This patch changes it, that QoS policy is always get with elevated
context during port/network create/update validation.

Change-Id: I464888ca3920b42edd6ab638f6a317ee51ef0994
Closes-Bug: #1750591
"}]
commit_message:
Fix creation of port when network has admin's QoS policy set

In case when admin user creats QoS policy and will attach it to
user's namespace there was an issue with getting such QoS policy
with user's context to validate it.

This patch changes it, that QoS policy is always get with elevated
context during port/network create/update validation.

Change-Id: I464888ca3920b42edd6ab638f6a317ee51ef0994
Closes-Bug: #1750591

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-02 14:23:43.000000000', 'message': "(Temporarily) allow warnings in doc builds

Our doc builds recently started using Sphinx 1.7.1, which is now
emitting warnings like

   .../versioned_writes.py:docstring of
   ...VersionedWritesContext:1:duplicate object description of
   ...VersionedWritesContext, other instance in .../doc/source/middleware.rst,
   use :noindex: for one of them

...which just doesn't make sense -- VersionedWritesContext has no
docstring, and middleware.rst is just trying to autodoc the module that
it's complaining about.

Change-Id: Id6678dd7e59a85bc2a7b3ba3d41d28e08956ae3e
"}, {'created': '2018-03-02 14:57:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix new doc warnings resulting from Sphinx 1.7.1

Change-Id: Id6678dd7e59a85bc2a7b3ba3d41d28e08956ae3e
'}]

commit_message:
OSC command for magnum quota's

Implemented Openstack command for quotas-create, quotas-update,
quotas-delete, quotas-show and quotas-list.

Change-Id: I889c2384afdf4cf113345af646b865271784c40c
Partially-Implements: blueprint deprecate-magnum-client

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 19:32:11.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve hostnames if needed to allow access in ufw

In some cases juju 1.25 (with maas 1.9) may return a hostname in the
private-address field breaking the assumption that private-address will
always be an IP address. This patch uses socket.getaddrinfo() to assure
an IP address is given to ufw.

Change-Id: I99b0110beed6075164eb549ec2433071af699c04
Closes-Bug: 1747516
(cherry picked from commit 4896ac5b5b98f66cfe79c3945680ac0ac5dbb2bf)
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve hostnames if needed to allow access in ufw

In some cases juju 1.25 (with maas 1.9) may return a hostname in the
private-address field breaking the assumption that private-address will
always be an IP address. This patch uses socket.getaddrinfo() to assure
an IP address is given to ufw.

Change-Id: I99b0110beed6075164eb549ec2433071af699c04
Closes-Bug: 1747516
(cherry picked from commit 4896ac5b5b98f66cfe79c3945680ac0ac5dbb2bf)

commit_message:
Add neutron-vpnaas as networking plugin

The neutron-vpnaas project has been re-added as official Neutron
sub-project for the Queens cycle, so we should link to its
documentation. Specific guides are still being worked upon and will be
added at a later stage.

Change-Id: Ic0695ee7ee1b8a3a4d18c419954fc0faa7a320e4
Partial-Bug: 1751069

commit_message:
[www] Fix release specific links

These linked to /latest instead of /queens/ or /pike/, fix all
the references.

Note that this is also correct for rocky, our tools use "latest" for the
development version which is rocky. Doing this also for rocky will avoid
copying these over and having wrong links.

Change-Id: I901aaace173721d7351ef31f4f579ae24a679dd8

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-23 04:53:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-01-23 06:28:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-01-23 15:26:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-01-23 15:29:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-25 04:28:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-25 07:09:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-02-01 06:39:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

I have incorporated this into  Ib80acbfd9a12efd976c3fa15a5d1081eb0799305 which I'd like feedback on.

The idea is that we have a bit of a matrix so I'm thinking the easiest thing is just that the bootloader element requires a block-device- element.  so for example, aarch64 would only be

  disk-image-create block-device-efi vm distro-minimal

x86 would have the choice of mbr, gpt and efi (with mbr and gpt installing grub-pc, and efi grub-efi)

power would have the coice of mbr and gpt (if you want larger disks), but efi will error out

the elements set a flag for the bootloader so it installs the right thing

you can still override the block-device config (if you want lvm partitions, etc) ... you can write your own element too which just has to export the relevant things."}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-03-02 15:36:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

merged into https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539731/9'}]

commit_message:
bootloader: handle grub-efi better

Both EFI and PC grub can read MBR and GPT disks now.

BIOS disk support is required/provided only by 'grub-pc'

Also install grub in 'removable media' path as we lack nvram for efivars
(it is part of VM not image).

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-01 23:33:33.000000000', 'message': "Disambiguate DHCP agent's subnet lookup for an endpoint

We've been seeing flakes in the Tempest test test_cross_tenant_traffic,
and this commit is the fix for those flakes.  That test includes
launching instances for different tenants, and it commonly happens that
two of those instances - on different Neutron networks - get assigned
the same IP address.  This is technically outside Calico's scope -
because Calico requires that all tenants share a single address space,
and hence it should not be possible for the same IP address to be
allocated to more than instance, even if they belong to different
tenants - however the fix is quite straightforward, and this test used
to pass reliably before the transition to etcdv3, so I think it's worth
fixing anyway.

In order to provide correct DHCP service, the DHCP agent needs to map
each local endpoint IP correctly to a Neutron subnet and network.  Since
the etcdv3 transition, it does that by comparing each endpoint IP
against the CIDR of each known Neutron subnet.  However this is
ambiguous if there are multiple subnets with overlapping CIDRs.  The
result is that the DHCP agent may try to pass multiple IP/MAC mappings,
for the same IP, to a dnsmasq process; the dnsmasq process then
complains about a 'duplicate' and ignores one of the mappings, which
means that that VM will not get DHCP service when it boots, and won't
learn its IP address.

To fix this, we add an annotation to each WorkloadEndpoint with the
corresponding Neutron network_id.  Then, when finding the right subnet
for an endpoint IP, we also check that subnet's network_id against the
network_id for the endpoint.

Change-Id: Iac19e151177d25d26597610008fe94b23d01483a

commit_message:
Disambiguate DHCP agent's subnet lookup for an endpoint

We've been seeing flakes in the Tempest test test_cross_tenant_traffic,
and this commit is the fix for those flakes.  That test includes
launching instances for different tenants, and it commonly happens that
two of those instances - on different Neutron networks - get assigned
the same IP address.  This is technically outside Calico's scope -
because Calico requires that all tenants share a single address space,
and hence it should not be possible for the same IP address to be
allocated to more than instance, even if they belong to different
tenants - however the fix is quite straightforward, and this test used
to pass reliably before the transition to etcdv3, so I think it's worth
fixing anyway.

In order to provide correct DHCP service, the DHCP agent needs to map
each local endpoint IP correctly to a Neutron subnet and network.  Since
the etcdv3 transition, it does that by comparing each endpoint IP
against the CIDR of each known Neutron subnet.  However this is
ambiguous if there are multiple subnets with overlapping CIDRs.  The
result is that the DHCP agent may try to pass multiple IP/MAC mappings,
for the same IP, to a dnsmasq process; the dnsmasq process then
complains about a 'duplicate' and ignores one of the mappings, which
means that that VM will not get DHCP service when it boots, and won't
learn its IP address.

To fix this, we add an annotation to each WorkloadEndpoint with the
corresponding Neutron network_id.  Then, when finding the right subnet
for an endpoint IP, we also check that subnet's network_id against the
network_id for the endpoint.

Change-Id: Iac19e151177d25d26597610008fe94b23d01483a

* Add xenial/queens to gate amulet tests
* Add NS records option as this cannot be set through the
  designate v2 api and v1 api is gone in Queens
* Update pools.yaml to include NS records. The previous
  setting 'dns_server_record' which was referenced in the
  template is not set by the charm.
* Update amulet tests to do designate v2 api compatible
  tests for Queens.

Change-Id: I314e42a51458b0c4542acc823d4fe0c875697087

commit_message:
Add xenial Queens amulet tests to gate

* Add xenial/queens to gate amulet tests
* Add NS records option as this cannot be set through the
  designate v2 api and v1 api is gone in Queens
* Update pools.yaml to include NS records. The previous
  setting 'dns_server_record' which was referenced in the
  template is not set by the charm.
* Update amulet tests to do designate v2 api compatible
  tests for Queens.

Change-Id: I314e42a51458b0c4542acc823d4fe0c875697087

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-22 19:03:33.000000000', 'message': "Move execution of 'tools/check-releasenotes.py' to pep8

The 'releasenotes' gate job does not run our tox section. This allowed a
releasenote to land that was not in the correct format and was not
created with 'reno new'.

Move the running of 'tools/check-releasenotes.py' to the pep8 section
and whitelist the releasenote that got merged.

Change-Id: Id5bd8e0cbc9186c89f682224088a8f23998d59c3
"}, {'created': '2018-03-02 12:20:32.000000000', 'message': "Move execution of 'tools/check-releasenotes.py' to pep8

The 'releasenotes' gate job does not run our tox section. This allowed a
releasenote to land that had a filename in an incorrect format because
it was not created with 'reno new'.

Move the running of 'tools/check-releasenotes.py' to the pep8 section
and whitelist the releasenote that got merged.

Change-Id: Id5bd8e0cbc9186c89f682224088a8f23998d59c3
"}]
commit_message:
Move execution of 'tools/check-releasenotes.py' to pep8

The 'releasenotes' gate job does not run our tox section. This allowed a
releasenote to land that had a filename in an incorrect format because
it was not created with 'reno new'.

Move the running of 'tools/check-releasenotes.py' to the pep8 section
and whitelist the releasenote that got merged.

Change-Id: Id5bd8e0cbc9186c89f682224088a8f23998d59c3

commit_message:
Fix up amulet for queens

Queens ceilometer requires a number of different services and
relations, the amulet functional tests have been updated for
that. Also move to using charmhelper keystone v3 api helpers.

Change-Id: I432c8937693fb47e7ca52e6dafe143a0143c437d
Requires: https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/119
